threads.narrative: This thread explores the specific mechanisms that allow "parts" to form intelligent wholes. It moves from identifying bioelectricity as the signaling medium, to confirming the cognitive capacities of individual cells, to using computational models to show how simple algorithms in these parts lead to complex collective behavior.

threads.name: Substrate Independence of Cognitive Systems

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Argues that goals and preferences are substrate-independent, allowing for the introduction of engineered components into biological cognitive systems.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Extends the functionalist perspective to include bio-robotic hybrids and AI, rejecting the requirement that cognitive systems must be made of specific neural substrates.

threads.narrative: This thread broadens the claim to show that the "parts" of an intelligent system need not be strictly biological. It connects the TAME framework's substrate neutrality with recent advancements in bio-robotics and synthetic biology, reinforcing that intelligence arises from the functional arrangement of parts rather than their specific material.

threads.name: Scaling Computation to Collective Selfhood

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposed that bioelectricity acts as the mechanism for scaling information, allowing the expansion of cognitive boundaries from cells to an integrated "Self."

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalized bioelectricity as a computational layer that provides a substrate-independent way to define and alter the goals and preferences of a system.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Established bioelectricity as the "cognitive glue" that determines large-scale behaviors at the tissue level, distinct from cell-level properties.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical development of bioelectricity as the specific mechanism that binds individual subunits into a cohesive agent. It moves from the initial proposal of bioelectricity defining the boundaries of a "Self" to a formalized framework (TAME) explaining how this layer manages collective goals.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Distributed Morphological Memory

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified that tissues use bioelectric circuits to implement distributed pattern memories that set target morphologies for anatomical homeostasis.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: described a modular control architecture where bioelectric circuits automatically activate complex developmental goals without micromanaging subunits.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the specific "how" of the claim: discovering that non-neural tissues possess distributed, re-writable memory media. It establishes that anatomical goals are stored in the bioelectric circuit dynamics of the collective rather than in the genome of individual cells.

threads.name: Evolutionary Continuity of Goal-Directedness

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Hypothesized that the cognitive hierarchy begins with homeostasis as its "atom," evolving into complex counterfactual processing.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Validated that bioelectric integration of information for decision-making is a universal scheme found from bacterial biofilms to human nervous systems.

threads.narrative: This thread provides converging evidence that the "magic" of emergent goals is a fundamental property of life, not unique to brains. It links the sophisticated preferences of complex organisms back to ancient bioelectric mechanisms used by microbial collectives to integrate information.

threads.name: Theoretical Framework of Continuous Cognition

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes a framework where goal-directedness and information processing scale continuously from simple homeostasis to complex cognition.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the commitment to gradualism, arguing that searching for a binary "bright line" between non-cognitive and cognitive systems is futile.

milestones.paper_title: Design for an Individual: Connectionist Approaches to the Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality
milestones.finding: Hypothesizes a functional equivalence between connectionist learning and evolutionary transitions, providing a theoretical basis for how individuality scales up.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the conceptual foundation for the claim, moving from an initial proposal of "scale-free cognition" to a formalized framework (TAME) that explicitly rejects discrete steps in cognitive evolution. It is supported by theoretical work linking evolutionary transitions to neural network principles, reinforcing the view of a smooth continuum.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Basal and Morphogenetic Intelligence

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Identifies developmental bioelectricity as a specific mechanism that drives multicellular coordination, bridging the gap between cell-level and organism-level intelligence.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Traces bioelectric signaling and information integration back to bacterial biofilms, demonstrating these mechanisms predate complex brains.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Links developmental plasticity and morphogenesis to "basal cognition," showing that anatomical-level intelligence shares control policies with behavioral intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the biological evidence supporting the claim by identifying specific mechanisms—primarily bioelectricity and morphogenetic competency—that operate continuously across scales. It demonstrates that the machinery for cognition exists in simpler systems (like biofilms and developing embryos), refuting the idea that biology offers a specific step where cognitive powers suddenly appear.

threads.name: Computational Definition of Scale-Free Selfhood

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes an information-centered definition of the Self based on computational boundaries and bioelectricity rather than fixed biological borders.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Expands the definition of selfhood into a 'continuum of persuadability' applicable to diverse combinations of living and non-living components.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Synthesizes the framework into a unifying concept where collective behavior and multi-scale competency are fundamental to all forms of intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical development of 'Self' from a static biological object to a dynamic computational boundary. It begins by establishing how bioelectricity allows a collective to store information distinct from its parts, refines this into a formal framework (TAME) for classifying agents, and solidifies it as a unifying concept for biological intelligence.

threads.name: Collective Navigation of Morphospace

milestones.paper_title: Control Flow in Active Inference Systems—Part II: Tensor Networks as General Models of Control Flow
milestones.finding: Models how cellular collectives use context-sensitive control flow to navigate 'morphospace' (anatomical goals) as a unified entity.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Demonstrates experimentally that individual cells exhibit novel, latent competencies when freed from the collective's instructive influence.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Frames the unification of millions of cells toward a common purpose as a specific evolutionary mechanism of 'basal cognition' and collective intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread investigates the specific mechanisms by which a collective achieves goals (like organ shape) that individual cells cannot perceive. It moves from modeling the control flow of these collectives to experimental evidence showing how the boundary between individual and collective competencies shifts, supporting the claim that the collective possesses distinct goals.

threads.name: Evolutionary and Developmental Continuity

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes a framework where goal-directedness scales naturally from simple homeostatic pathways to complex cognition without distinct boundaries.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Asserts that transitions between diverse intelligences are not binary or rapid, but rather continuous processes involving proto-cognitive capacities.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Illustrates the claim via the developmental journey from oocyte to human, arguing that matter acquires mind through slow, gradual modifications.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the core theoretical argument that neither evolution nor individual development presents a specific 'step' where cognition emerges. It builds a narrative of 'scale-free' cognition, where the difference between simple cellular behavior and complex human thought is one of degree and scale, not fundamental kind.

threads.name: Bioelectric Scaling Mechanism

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Identifies non-neural bioelectricity as a mechanism capable of supporting cognitive-like processing and semantic interpretations in somatic tissues.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Generalizes neural computation to cellular computation, tracing the bioelectric signaling mechanism back to bacterial biofilms.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Investigates plesiomorphic (ancestral) versions of decision-making in non-neural contexts like regeneration to unify biological scales.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the mechanistic explanation for the claim of continuity. It traces the discovery that the bioelectric signaling used by the brain is phylogenetically ancient and operates in all cells, providing the physical substrate that allows cognition to scale smoothly from microbes to multicellular organisms.

threads.name: Bioelectric Basis of Cognitive Scaling

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes an information-centered definition of Self driven by developmental bioelectricity, emphasizing shifting boundaries rather than fixed binary states.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the self as existing on a continuum of persuadability (TAME framework), rejecting binary transitions in cognitive function.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric networks as the specific mechanism enabling evolutionary scaling from physiological dynamics to high-level mental states.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the physical mechanism—bioelectricity—that allows 'selfhood' to exist as a continuum rather than a binary trait. It progresses from defining the self via computational boundaries to establishing a formal framework (TAME) and finally articulating how bioelectric networks serve as the 'glue' connecting physiological processes to complex cognition.

threads.name: Evolutionary Transitions in Agency

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Argues that biological cooperation and multicellularity result from the scaling of homeostatic loops, expanding the borders of the Self.

milestones.paper_title: Design for an Individual: Connectionist Approaches to the Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality
milestones.finding: Applies connectionist learning principles to explain how individuality and agency evolve through bottom-up selection mechanisms.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Posits that morphological intelligence in developmental biology is the evolutionary precursor to behavioral intelligence, demonstrating a continuous lineage of agency.

threads.narrative: This thread outlines the evolutionary logic refuting the 'magical' appearance of the self, proposing instead that agency scales bottom-up through specific biological transitions. It links the expansion of homeostatic loops to connectionist models of individuality, culminating in the view that brain-based cognition is a direct evolutionary scaling of earlier morphogenetic competencies.

threads.name: Collective Decision-Making in Embryogenesis

milestones.paper_title: The compulsion of chirality: toward an understanding of left-right asymmetry.
milestones.finding: Established that conjoined twins exhibit specific visceral laterality defects distinct from non-conjoined twins, suggesting complex signaling interactions between dual axes.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Formalized the 'scratch' phenomenon as a failure of collective sensing, where separated blastoderm regions individuate because they cannot sense the other's presence until healing occurs.

threads.narrative: This thread evolves from observing the morphological consequences of twinning (asymmetry/chirality) to a theoretical framework explaining the 'scratch' mechanism. It reframes the embryo as an excitable medium where physical connectivity determines whether cells act as a single unit or distinct individuals.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Axis Interaction in Twins

milestones.paper_title: The compulsion of chirality: toward an understanding of left-right asymmetry.
milestones.finding: Noted that conjoined twins often display mirror-image asymmetries, highlighting the developmental plasticity and interference between adjacent developing axes.

milestones.paper_title: Polarity proteins are required for left–right axis orientation and twin–twin instruction
milestones.finding: Identified that polarity proteins are required for the 'Big Brother' effect, where one organizer instructs the orientation of the other in conjoined scenarios.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the 'conjoined' aspect of the claim, moving from phenotypic descriptions of twins to the molecular mechanisms (polarity proteins) that govern how two induced embryonic regions communicate and establish dominance or orientation.

threads.name: Scaling Competency via Bioelectric Networks

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes that developmental bioelectricity is the driver that enables multicellularity and defines the spatiotemporal boundaries of a cognitive "self" beyond single cells.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric networks as the specific "cognitive glue" enabling memories and goals to reside in the whole animal rather than in its parts alone.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Details how mechanisms like gap junctions allow the sharing of cellular memories and stress propagation to establish higher-order individuals with expanded perceptual fields.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of the physical mechanisms that allow individual cells to bind into a collective intelligence. It progresses from the theoretical proposal of bioelectricity defining the "self" to the identification of specific networking mechanisms (gap junctions, bioelectric networks) that scale competencies up from the cellular level.

threads.name: Navigation of Anatomical Morphospace

milestones.paper_title: Control Flow in Active Inference Systems—Part II: Tensor Networks as General Models of Control Flow
milestones.finding: Models cellular collectives as navigating complex problem spaces, including "anatomical morphospace," via context-sensitive control flow rather than fixed genetic instructions.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Argues that basal cellular competencies scale up to allow collectives to operate in larger, more complex problem spaces, achieving morphological goals via different means.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Validates the framework with grafting experiments where cells undergo compensatory migration to achieve the collective's goal, overriding their individual history or local perception.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical framework that collective systems effectively "navigate" a space of possible shapes (morphospace) to reach a target. It moves from mathematical modeling of control flow to experimental evidence showing that collectives can correct for drastic interventions to reach specific anatomical goals.

threads.name: Bioelectric Scaling of Selfhood Boundaries

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes an information-centered definition of the Self where bioelectricity facilitates the boundaries and control policies necessary for agency.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Expands the framework to explain how smaller competent selves bind into higher-order selves via bioelectric boundaries, and how this fails in cancer.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Generalizes these boundaries as 'agential materials' that allow matter to support pattern homeostasis and multiscale competency.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical core of the claim, defining the 'boundary' not merely as physical, but as a computational interface mediated by bioelectricity. It traces the concept from a basic definition of information flow to a comprehensive model of how evolution scales these boundaries to create complex, goal-seeking individuals.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Goal-Directed Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Identifies anatomical pattern memory as a specific target morphology (goal) that drives regeneration, contrasting it with simple emergent behavior.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Formalizes the pursuit of morphological goals as a Bayesian inference process, allowing prediction and control of the system's self-organization.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Broadens the mechanism of boundary maintenance to include 'homeorhesis' and organizational closure across neuronal and immune systems.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the 'ability to pursue certain goals' aspect of the claim. It progresses from biological observations of target morphologies in regeneration to mathematical formalizations (Bayesian inference) explaining how systems maintain the boundaries required for self-organization.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Modulation of potassium channel function confers a hyperproliferative invasive phenotype on embryonic stem cells
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that patterning membrane voltage in embryos controls cell proliferation and invasive phenotypes, providing a mechanism for tissue organization.

milestones.paper_title: Particle tracking model of electrophoretic morphogen movement reveals stochastic dynamics of embryonic gradient
milestones.finding: Modeled how voltage gradients in the embryo can electrophoretically transport morphogens across cell fields to establish spatial patterns.

milestones.paper_title: Depolarization Alters Phenotype, Maintains Plasticity of Predifferentiated Mesenchymal Stem Cells
milestones.finding: Showed that membrane depolarization alone is sufficient to alter phenotypes and maintain plasticity in stem cells, confirming the instructive role of voltage.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the biophysical mechanisms by which a "flat disk" of cells organizes into a complex embryo. It progresses from identifying voltage gradients in embryos to modeling their transport of morphogens and validating that voltage changes directly alter cell fate and behavior.

threads.name: Non-Neural Developmental Cognition

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Proposed that long-distance communication mechanisms similar to neural networks exist in non-neural developmental tissues.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Framed the multiplication and diversification of cells from a single egg as a cognitive process distributed across the body, not restricted to the brain.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Argued that the "blastomere descendants" of the egg possess agential competency to construct complex anatomy without explicit geometric instruction.

threads.narrative: This thread reframes the claim's subject (the developing embryo) from a passive structure to a cognitive agent. It builds the theory that the collection of cells possesses distributed intelligence and communication abilities that guide development before a brain or nervous system exists.

threads.name: Statistical Formalization of Self-Boundaries

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Demonstrates how variational free energy formulations can simulate self-assembling autopoietic behavior and pattern formation.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Links self-organization and self-evidencing to the creation of a "statistical boundary" (Markov blanket) separating the system from the environment.

milestones.paper_title: Control Flow in Active Inference Systems—Part I: Classical and Quantum Formulations of Active Inference
milestones.finding: Formalizes the Markov blanket as the functional equivalent of a cell membrane that maintains the internal states required for homeostasis.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the mathematical formalization of autopoiesis, moving from simulations of morphogenesis to the definition of statistical boundaries (Markov blankets) that separate a self-evidencing system from its environment.

threads.name: Bioelectric Scaling of Individual Boundaries

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes an information-centered definition of Self where boundaries are flexible, defined by control policies rather than fixed anatomy.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explains how bioelectric networks solve the "many-into-one" problem, allowing boundaries to shift and smaller competent selves to merge into a larger emergent Self.

threads.narrative: This thread explores how the boundary of a "Self" is defined by computational and bioelectric competence, demonstrating how evolutionary mechanisms allow these boundaries to shift and scale from single cells to multicellular organisms.

threads.name: Physiological Maintenance of Spatial Boundaries

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Establishes the generative models required for cells to self-assemble into coherent structures.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Identifies the coupling of neuronal and immune systems as the mechanism for "spatial encapsulation" and maintaining the entropy-dissipating conditions of the self.

threads.narrative: Investigating the physical realization of self-boundaries, this thread links computational models of self-assembly to the physiological necessity of immune and neuronal coupling for maintaining an organism's distinct spatial organization.

threads.name: Evolutionary Utility of Competency

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes that multi-scale competency accelerates evolution by allowing lineages to exploit opportunities and mask negative mutation consequences.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Expands the theory to describe biological systems as "agential materials" that exploit physical laws and computation to solve problems.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Formalizes the view that biology is functionally nested, with each level solving problems in distinct spaces (physiological, morphological, behavioral).

threads.narrative: This thread traces the development of the theoretical argument that multi-scale competency is not just a feature of biology but a driver of evolutionary success. It moves from the initial proposal of how competency speeds up evolution to a formalized definition of functional nesting where every level solves specific problems.

threads.name: Bioelectricity as Scaling Mechanism

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric circuits as control systems that can be hijacked to manipulate anatomical goals, such as head number in planaria.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Posits bioelectricity as the specific "cognitive glue" that enables adaptive information processing to scale from simple physiology to complex cognition.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the specific physiological mechanism—bioelectricity—proposed to enable goal-directed behavior across scales. It connects early experimental observations of anatomical control to a broader theory of bioelectricity as the medium for collective intelligence.

threads.name: Generalization Across Substrates

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Establishes planarian regeneration as a specific model for investigating anatomical homeostasis and goal-directed morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates the application of AI tools to identify behavioral competencies in systems ranging from molecular assemblies to swarms.

threads.narrative: This thread illustrates the expansion of the competency concept from specific biological models to a universal principle. It progresses from investigating anatomical goals in flatworms to applying AI discovery tools across the entire spectrum of biological organizations, from molecules to swarms.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectrical signaling as a key mechanism for reprogramming tissue patterning and designing novel biological architectures.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates through computational modeling that non-neural tissue can be trained to perform logic functions, validating the 'somatic computation' capability.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of a 'biological software layer' where morphogenetic goals can be re-written via signaling without altering the genetic hardware.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery and formalization of bioelectricity as a manipulatable 'software' layer in biology. It moves from establishing the mechanism of bioelectric reprogramming to validating it via computational models, culminating in the definition of a control layer independent of genetic hardware.

threads.name: Competency in Evolutionary Processes

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes that multi-scale autonomy allows systems to exploit opportunities and hide mutation consequences, suggesting adaptation happens via competency rather than just hardware selection.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Argues that developmental physiology acts as a competency layer that 'smooths' the evolutionary landscape, allowing rapid morphological changes via signaling adjustments.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theory that cellular signaling constitutes a form of agency that drives evolution. It suggests that the 'signals cells give each other' allow for rapid adaptation and problem-solving that precedes and facilitates genetic (hardware) changes.

threads.name: Bioelectric Basis of Cognitive Scaling

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposed bioelectricity as the mechanism that expands homeostatic boundaries, allowing cell collectives to scale information into larger agents.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Distinguished developmental bioelectricity as a unique computational layer enabling the scaling of the cognitive self beyond single cells.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Characterized bioelectric networks as the "cognitive glue" enabling the transition from individual cell physiology to collective minds.

threads.narrative: This thread identifies bioelectricity as the physical mechanism facilitating the evolutionary transition from single-cell competencies to multicellular cognition. It traces the development of the hypothesis that bioelectric networks serve as the computational medium for scaling agency.

threads.name: Evolution of Problem-Solving Spaces

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Framed morphogenesis as "somatic cognition," where cellular mechanisms of cognitive binding allow navigation of anatomical problems.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Argued that behavioral intelligence was evolutionarily predated by the "diverse intelligence" of morphogenetic processes operating in anatomical space.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Generalized the concept to a multi-scale competency architecture where all intelligences consist of parts solving problems in unconventional spaces.

threads.narrative: This thread builds the theoretical argument that intelligence evolved by repurposing problem-solving strategies across different "spaces." It establishes the continuity between cells navigating metabolic/physiological space, tissues navigating anatomical space (morphogenesis), and organisms navigating behavioral space.

threads.name: Computational Boundaries of Selfhood

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes an information-centered definition of "Self" based on the shifting boundaries of control and nested structures.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Models self-assembling autopoietic behavior using variational free energy to show how cell ensembles simulate morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: Control Flow in Active Inference Systems—Part I: Classical and Quantum Formulations of Active Inference
milestones.finding: Formalizes the biological cell membrane as a Markov blanket that defines the boundary between internal states and the external environment.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical formalization of the "self" not as a static biological object, but as a computational boundary defined by information flow. It evolves from a conceptual definition of nested hierarchies to mathematical models using Bayesian inference and Markov blankets to define autopoiesis.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Anatomical Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Contrasts bottom-up emergence with "pattern memory," suggesting specific anatomical goals drive regeneration despite starting conditions.

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Argues that regulative development requires top-down goal states rather than just local agent interactions to explain complex shape formation.

threads.narrative: This thread explores how cells, which are environments to one another, coordinate to build complex structures "from scratch." It moves from observing regeneration to proposing that anatomical goal states (pattern memory) override simple local self-organization.

threads.name: Nested Organization Across Scales

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes that survival and decision-making occur at the cellular level, framing cells as cognitive agents within larger systems.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Demonstrates how distinct self-organizing systems (immune and neural) couple to maintain the whole organism in non-equilibrium conditions.

threads.narrative: This thread examines the claim that every cell is an environment for others by looking at cross-system integration. It highlights how autonomous cellular cognition is recursively dependent, scaling up to form the larger "self" of the organism.

threads.name: Formalization of Agential Materials Framework

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Proposed planarian regeneration as a model for anatomical homeostasis, framing biological repair as an information processing task with goal states.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly defined the Multi-Scale Competency Architecture (MCA), positing that competency allows lineages to solve problems and hide negative mutation consequences.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Refined the framework to describe biological matter as "agential materials" where basal cellular competencies scale up to collective intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical maturation of the claim, starting from specific observations of anatomical homeostasis in regeneration to a generalized framework (TAME/MCA) that redefines biological substrates as problem-solving agents at every scale.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Scaling Competency

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectricity as the "cognitive glue" that enables adaptive information processing to scale from single cells to complex organismal behavior.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Detailed the mechanism of "informational scaling" via strong cell-cell coupling, explaining how lower-level competencies are harnessed for higher-level goals.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that behavioral competencies and control problems exist even in substrate-independent biological networks and molecular assemblies.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the "how" of the claim, investigating the specific physical and informational mechanisms—primarily bioelectricity and network coupling—that allow goal-directed behavior to transition from molecular networks to whole-body systems.

threads.name: Pragmatic Engineering Framework for Cognition

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposes replacing philosophical definitions of knowledge with a pragmatic, cybernetics-based engineering approach focused on prediction.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Argues for a functional isomorphism between patterning and cognitive processes, validating the application of computational terms to non-neural systems.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the engineering perspective into a framework (TAME) that treats diverse biological systems as accessible control circuits.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from philosophical definitions of mind toward an engineering-based "intentional stance." It begins by suggesting cybernetics as a pragmatic tool for biology and evolves into a formalized framework where cognitive terms like "goal" and "competency" are applied to physiological regulation to enable prediction and control.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control and Morphogenetic Engineering

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectrical signaling not just as a biological phenomenon but as a programmable interface for designing novel architectures.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Models biological morphogenesis as a set of specific computational tasks and closed-loop control systems, validating the engineering utility of the perspective.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that "multiscale competency" allows for engineering-style controllability even in novel, cross-kingdom interactions.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the empirical utility of the engineering perspective: "building" things. It moves from identifying bioelectricity as a control mechanism to mathematically modeling morphogenesis as a computational loop, culminating in the demonstration that these control systems can be exploited to engineer novel biological structures.

threads.name: Multiscale Competency and Biological Individuality

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Modeled tumor-host interactions using game theory, establishing cancer cells as autonomous systems with internal goals and learning capabilities.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Explicitly posited that robots lack cancer because their parts lack agendas, whereas biological 'selves' are collectives of competent, goal-seeking subunits.

milestones.paper_title: Design for an Individual: Connectionist Approaches to the Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality
milestones.finding: Framed cancer as a breakdown of 'individuality,' where the alignment between the global agenda and local cellular agendas dissolves.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Generalized the concept to 'collective intelligence,' highlighting the inherent competition between the behaviors of wholes and the tendencies of their parts.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for the claim, moving from game-theoretic models of cancer to a broader definition of biological 'selfhood.' It argues that unlike robots, biological organisms are nested hierarchies of agents (cells, tissues) with their own agendas, where health is the successful alignment of these goals and cancer is their decoupling.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Agenda Alignment and Control

milestones.paper_title: Ion Channel and Neurotransmitter Modulators as Electroceutical Approaches to the Control of Cancer
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectric signaling as the specific mechanism that imposes global order (the organism's agenda) on local cell behaviors to prevent cancer.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Proposed 'active inference' as a method to model and therapeutically shape the decision-making competencies of tissues without micromanagement.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Used algorithmic models to demonstrate how local problem-solving competencies of subsystems can result in global morphological order.

threads.narrative: This thread investigates *how* biology manages the agendas of its parts (the problem implied by the claim). It progresses from identifying bioelectricity as the control medium to applying computational frameworks like active inference and sorting algorithms to understand how local cellular competencies are harnessed for global goals.

threads.name: Bioelectric Dynamics of Information Flow

milestones.paper_title: Early, H+-V-ATPase-dependent proton flux is necessary for consistent left-right patterning of non-mammalian vertebrates
milestones.finding: Identified that ion flux (H+) is a necessary upstream signal for patterning, establishing bioelectricity as a layer of developmental information.

milestones.paper_title: Particle tracking model of electrophoretic morphogen movement reveals stochastic dynamics of embryonic gradient
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that voltage gradients across tissues physically drive the movement of signaling molecules, creating the information field tissues compete for.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
milestones.finding: Revealed that developmental units exchange metabolic signals (ATP) and ions (Calcium) to regulate morphogenesis, highlighting the currency of these interactions.

threads.narrative: This thread uncovers the biophysical mechanisms—specifically bioelectricity and ion flux—that facilitate the transmission of developmental information and metabolic resources. It progresses from identifying ion pumps as essential for patterning to modeling how electrical gradients distribute morphogens, confirming the physical channels through which tissues interact and compete for information.

threads.name: Agential Competency and Morphological Goals

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Showed that displaced tissues actively adjust their shape and position to reach a target morphology, implying autonomous goal-seeking behavior.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Formalized the concept of homeostatic morphogenesis, modeling how tissues use feedback loops to correct errors and achieve specific forms.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Synthesized these observations into a framework of 'agential materials,' proposing that tissues possess multiscale competency to negotiate outcomes during development.

threads.narrative: This thread builds the theoretical and experimental case that tissues are not passive materials but active agents ('agential materials') that negotiate for space and form. It moves from observing innate anatomical correction to mathematical formalization, culminating in a framework where development is viewed as a competitive and cooperative interaction between competent modules.

threads.name: Formalizing Landscape Control via Inference

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric circuits as 'stable attractors' that guide cells toward discrete anatomical outcomes, serving as a functional implementation of a 'bent' option space.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Formalizes the claim by modeling morphogenesis as Bayesian inference, showing that manipulating the 'generative process' (the landscape) controls the system's self-organization.

milestones.paper_title: The nonlinearity of regulation in biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that imposing biological constraints systematically shapes the solution space to enable guided self-assembly and control of emergent complexity.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical formalization of the claim, moving from the biological observation of bioelectric attractors to a mathematical framework where higher levels control lower levels by manipulating the free energy landscape (or generative model) that lower levels optimize against.

threads.name: Mapping Competency Landscapes

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Uses minimal sorting arrays to show how local component interactions (following simple rules) can solve higher-level problems when the environment is structured correctly.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Empirically maps how non-genetic perturbations modulate the 'landscape of reachable cell phenotypes,' verifying that altering the option space changes lower-level behavior.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental and simulation-based evidence for the claim. It progresses from basic models showing how local rules yield global order to advanced AI-driven tools that visualize and manipulate the specific 'option spaces' (phenotypic landscapes) of biological networks.

threads.name: Evolutionary Architecture of Control

milestones.paper_title: Design for an Individual: Connectionist Approaches to the Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality
milestones.finding: Proposes that evolutionary transitions involve changing population interaction structures so that individuals act to support higher-level selection rather than disrupting it.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Describes an 'evolutionary intelligence ratchet' where higher levels succeed by exploiting the computational competencies of lower levels rather than micromanaging them.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the evolutionary mechanism behind the claim, suggesting that evolution selects for architectures where higher levels manipulate the environment (or interaction structure) of lower levels to harness their innate competencies for complex goals.

milestones.finding: Expands the definition of intelligent problem-solving to include navigation of transcriptional and physiological spaces.

threads.narrative: This thread provides evidence that cognitive principles function as engineering invariants across biological scales. The evidence is used to argue that morphogenesis functions as a goal-directed, problem-solving system (using concepts like active inference and bioelectric networks) rather than a fixed mechanical process.

threads.name: Pragmatic Engineering Framework for Cognition

milestones.finding: Proposes replacing philosophical definitions of knowledge with a pragmatic, cybernetics-based engineering approach to predict behavior.

milestones.finding: Argues that signaling in multicelluar systems is functionally equivalent to brain dynamics, treating cells as locally-competent micro-agents.

threads.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture Framework

milestones.finding: Establishes that basal cellular competencies scale up to form collective intelligences, allowing higher levels to operate in complex problem spaces.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Inter-Level Coordination

It progresses from recognizing cellular cognition to mathematically validating how constraints enable control, culminating in a unified theory of biological collective intelligence where higher levels manipulate the search space of lower-level agents.

threads.name: Theoretical Framework of Somatic Intelligence

threads.name: Morphogenesis as Physical Problem-Solving

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical development of the Multiscale Competency Architecture (MCA), establishing that biological systems are nested hierarchies of agential materials where problem-solving occurs simultaneously at the cellular, tissue, and organismal levels.

threads.name: Evolution of Problem Spaces

threads.name: Multiscale Agential Architecture vs. Flatness

threads.name: Self-Organization and Morphogenetic Control

milestones.finding: Proposes that higher-order entities function by distorting the energy landscape of subunits, utilizing subunit competency to navigate spaces the subunits cannot perceive.

threads.name: Emergent Autonomy in Bio-Hybrid Systems

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Establishes that minimizing variational free energy allows systemic dynamics to be characterized as Bayesian inference (belief updating).

It connects the foundational physics of membrane potential to clinical observations, showing that loss of the specific voltage set-point correlates with disease states like cancer.

threads.name: Formalizing the Bioelectric Computational Layer

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposed a "computational pipeline" to extract goal patterns from bioelectric states, parallel to brain decoding.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Modeled non-neural bioelectric networks (BEN) to demonstrate they possess neural-like computational features such as weights and biases.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly defined developmental bioelectricity as a "unique computational layer" separate from gene-regulatory or biochemical mechanisms.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical formalization of bioelectricity from an observable signal to a distinct information-processing layer. It moves from the initial concept of decoding bioelectric "goals" to mathematical modeling of somatic computation, culminating in a framework where bioelectricity acts as the software layer of basal cognition.

threads.name: Bioelectricity as a Cognitive Interface

milestones.paper_title: Revisiting Burr and Northrop’s “The Electro-Dynamic Theory of Life” (1935)
milestones.finding: Validated that bioelectric prepatterns effectively predict and direct large-scale patterning in systems like planaria and plants.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectricity as a "tractable entry point" that allows external agents to access and reset morphological goals.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Described bioelectricity as the primary mechanism for scaling computation, enabling access to tissue-level behaviors beyond cell-level properties.

threads.narrative: This thread gathers evidence showing how bioelectricity serves as an actionable interface for controlling biological systems. It progresses from validating the predictive power of bioelectric patterns to establishing them as a "handle" for rewriting morphogenetic outcomes, supporting the claim of "accessing actual cognition."

threads.name: Generalizing Neural Dynamics to Basal Cognition

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Argued for the existence of cognition throughout biological systems, suggesting bioelectricity as the common language.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Generalized neural computation principles to cellular computation, showing how bioelectric signaling integrates information for decision-making across all tissues.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Framed bioelectricity as the "cognitive glue" that unifies adaptive problem-solving across scales, from physiology to mind.

threads.narrative: This thread illustrates the unification of neural and non-neural cognition under a single bioelectric framework. It demonstrates how principles originally derived from neuroscience are successfully applied to understand "basal cognition" in non-neural tissues.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Early, H+-V-ATPase-dependent proton flux is necessary for consistent left-right patterning of non-mammalian vertebrates
milestones.finding: Identified that H+-V-ATPase pumps drive proton fluxes to establish voltage gradients essential for embryonic left-right patterning.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Proposed that membrane voltage serves as a key informational parameter carrying signals for regeneration and morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: HCN2 Channel-Induced Rescue of Brain Teratogenesis via Local and Long-Range Bioelectric Repair
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that artificially manipulating membrane voltage using specific ion channels (HCN2) can repair brain defects, validating the causal role of voltage patterns.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the experimental validation that cells actively maintain and use voltage gradients for structural development. It moves from early observations of ion pumps in embryonic patterning to the demonstration that correcting these voltage states can rescue complex birth defects.

threads.name: Modeling Cellular Bioelectricity

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Called for the compilation of quantitative physiological data to create predictive models of the bioelectric state space.

milestones.paper_title: Exploring Instructive Physiological Signaling with the Bioelectric Tissue Simulation Engine
milestones.finding: Introduced BETSE, a simulation engine that models how ion fluxes and pumps maintain resting membrane potential and control cell excitability.

threads.narrative: This thread illustrates the theoretical progression from recognizing the need for quantitative analysis to the development of computational tools. These models formalize how cells expend energy via ion channels to maintain specific voltage differences and how these patterns behave in tissue networks.

threads.name: Universality Beyond the Nervous System

milestones.paper_title: Early, H+-V-ATPase-dependent proton flux is necessary for consistent left-right patterning of non-mammalian vertebrates
milestones.finding: Established that bioelectric signaling via plasma membrane pumps functions in non-neural developmental contexts.

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Explicitly generalized the concept, stating that every cell in the body possesses a membrane potential used for functions like immune suppression and ECM remodeling.

threads.narrative: This thread supports the specific claim that "all living cells" (not just neurons) maintain voltage differences. It aggregates evidence showing that bioelectric potential is a fundamental cellular property conserved across development, cancer biology, and immunology.

threads.name: Bioelectric Hardware as Computational Logic

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes that bioelectricity, implemented by ion channel and gap junction "protein hardware," allows for the flexible software of life, predating neural systems.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly defines biological hardware as ion channels (setting state) and controllable gap junctions (propagating state), analogous to computer architecture.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Reaffirms that the computational architecture of biological systems relies on cells setting resting potentials and communicating via controllable electrical synapses.

threads.narrative: This thread tracks the theoretical formalization of the claim, moving from general comparisons of biology and physics to a specific framework where ion channels and gap junctions are defined as the hardware components (akin to transistors) that enable biological computation and decision-making.

threads.name: Gating Mechanisms for Information Flow

milestones.paper_title: Particle tracking model of electrophoretic morphogen movement reveals stochastic dynamics of embryonic gradient
milestones.finding: Models the intracellular movement of molecular signals, establishing the physical basis for how charged molecules move through cellular connections.

milestones.paper_title: A Novel Method for Inducing Nerve Growth via Modulation of Host Resting Potential: Gap Junction-Mediated and Serotonergic Signaling Mechanisms
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that signaling molecules like serotonin move through gap junctions specifically along voltage gradients, acting as a voltage-sensitive gating mechanism.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Identifies that gap junctions can be manipulated to construct "computational synthetic living machines," validating the functional utility of this gating.

threads.narrative: This thread uncovers the physical mechanism supporting the claim: that gap junctions do not merely allow passive diffusion but act as controllable, voltage-sensitive gates (transistors) that direct information flow based on electrical gradients.

threads.name: Functional Control of Morphological Circuitry

milestones.paper_title: Long-range gap junctional signaling controls oncogene-mediated tumorigenesis in Xenopus laevis embryos
milestones.finding: Shows that long-range gap junction signaling acts as a control system for regulating cell activities like tumorigenesis across distances.

milestones.paper_title: HCN2 Rescues brain defects by enforcing endogenous voltage pre-patterns
milestones.finding: Uses a specific voltage-gated ion channel (HCN2) to enforce bioelectric patterns and rescue brain defects, demonstrating transistor-like control over complex geometry.

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Validates that gap junctions perform primitive functions similar to neural synapses, establishing a functional continuity between non-neural and neural electronics.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence that "inventing" (or introducing) these voltage-sensitive components allows researchers to access "cool things" like correcting brain defects or suppressing cancer, validating the functional power of the bioelectric circuit analogy.

threads.name: Kinematic Self-Replication Mechanism

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Identifies guided self-assembly and multicellular dynamics as key future goals for bioengineered organisms.
Describes the observation where Xenobots actively assemble loose cells into piles to create the next generation.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Validates the behavior as "kinematic replication," noting it is a novel solution distinct from genomic replication.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of kinematic replication in Xenobots. Research moved from the theoretical goal of guided self-assembly to the direct observation of bots physically compiling loose cells into offspring, a mechanism later formalized as kinematic replication.

threads.name: Von Neumann Theoretical Framework

milestones.finding: Links Xenobot replication to von Neumann's concept of non-biological self-replication, proposing that "the shape is the tape."

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Contextualizes this replication as an example of agential materials discovering novel problem-solving spaces (reproduction) without genetic change.

threads.narrative: This thread interprets the biological findings through the lens of automata theory. It argues that Xenobots realize von Neumann's vision of physical self-replication (kinematic) rather than biological (genetic) replication, treating the organism's physical form as its instruction set.

threads.name: Creation of Motile Xenobots

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Establishes the field of synthetic morphology, moving from single-cell modifications to 'living machines' (biobots) created via guided self-assembly.

milestones.paper_title: Scale invariant robot behavior with fractals
milestones.finding: Details the specific experimental protocol: removing the animal cap (skin) of Xenopus embryos causes them to form motile biobots.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Validates that frog skin cells, when freed from instructive embryo interactions, spontaneously form spherical, moving constructs (Xenobots).

threads.narrative: This thread documents the experimental progression of the claim, identifying the specific method of deriving motile organisms from frog skin cells and validating their resulting behavior as distinct from their natural developmental trajectory.

threads.name: Latent Cellular Competency

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes that morphogenesis involves goal-directed error minimization, where cells possess plasticity to navigate morphospace beyond invariant genetic instructions.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Argues that cellular plasticity allows for behaviors (like forming motile creatures) that exist outside the 'default' behaviors specified by the genome.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Conceptualizes the skin cells' transformation not as an anomaly, but as evidence of 'agential materials' capable of independent behavior when liberated from the collective.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the theoretical explanation for the claim, reframing the phenomenon as a demonstration of inherent cellular competency and agency that is typically suppressed by the organizational constraints of the whole embryo.

threads.name: Validation of Wild-Type Synthetic Morphology

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Defines Xenobots as 'living machines' created via guided self-assembly of cells, explicitly distinguishing them from organisms modified by genomic editing or metabolic rewiring.

milestones.paper_title: Expanding biology: what biorobots tell us about evolution, morphogenesis, and control (Levin commentary)
milestones.finding: Attributes the capability of Xenobots to assemble the next generation to the inherent 'competency of their components' (wild-type cells) rather than external engineering or nanomaterials.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the claim by demonstrating that functional biological machines can be constructed solely by guiding the self-assembly of wild-type cells. It progresses from establishing the definition of Xenobots as non-genetically modified entities to confirming that complex behaviors like kinematic replication arise from the innate plasticity of the biological material itself.

threads.name: Theory of Agential Materials

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Proposes that future bioengineering will focus on guiding multicellular dynamics and morphology rather than editing the genome.

milestones.paper_title: Expanding biology: what biorobots tell us about evolution, morphogenesis, and control (Levin commentary)
milestones.finding: Argues for expanding the concept of a 'program' to include the probabilistic, naturally-evolving control policies already embodied in biological components.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of cells as 'agential materials' that can be 'hacked' by external signals (like parasites or computer designs) to produce novel forms without genetic changes.

threads.narrative: This theoretical thread provides the explanatory framework for why a wild-type genome can produce unexpected

threads.name: From Micromanagement to Orchestration

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Argues for reprogramming information-processing pathways to orchestrate pattern formation rather than manipulating metabolic circuits in individual cells.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Critiques the biomedical focus on "cellular hardware" and proposes that bioelectricity provides a top-down control interface for regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes using "rewards and punishments" (inputs) to achieve anatomical control rather than micromanaging the underlying pathway hardware.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Contrasts structural rewiring strategies with recognizing the emergent, generative nature of physiological networks that can be guided rather than built.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from reductionist approaches to systems-level control in regenerative medicine. It establishes the argument that biological systems should be treated as agents that can be persuaded or orchestrated through high-level inputs, rather than machines requiring component-level micromanagement.

threads.name: Latent Competency and Anatomical Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: HDAC Activity Is Required during Xenopus Tail Regeneration
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectrical programs as the drivers of regenerative repair in complex structures, establishing a mechanism for high-level control.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Defines "anatomical homeostasis" as a scaled-up version of cellular feedback loops, allowing tissues to maintain target morphologies automatically.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that cells possess latent morphogenetic behaviors (e.g., biobots) that emerge when removed from the dominating controls of the whole body.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the biological mechanisms that justify treating tissues as "agential materials." It progresses from identifying specific bioelectrical triggers in amphibian regeneration to conceptualizing the inherent homeostatic loops that allow biological materials to reach target states without explicit instruction.

threads.name: Agential Materials vs. Passive Emergence

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identifies that purely bottom-up simulations face an intractable "inverse problem" regarding control, which biology solves through multi-scale autonomy.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Critiques the standard "emergence" paradigm in simulations, arguing they miss the "competency" of biological substrates that actively solve problems.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Proposes that biology's unique robustness and evolvability depend on an "agential material" architecture that standard simulations currently lack.

threads.narrative: This thread challenges the dominant computational view that biological complexity arises solely from simple rules interacting (emergence). It develops the argument that current simulations fail to capture the power of biology because they treat the substrate as passive matter rather than "agential material" composed of competent, problem-solving modules.

threads.name: Latent Competencies in Basal Algorithms

milestones.paper_title: The nonlinearity of regulation in biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that biological networks possess specific constraints and nonlinearities that distinguish them from unconstrained computational models.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Reveals that even simple algorithms possess "unexpected competencies" and problem-solving capacities not explicitly encoded, serving as a minimal model for what simulations miss.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Concludes that intelligence is comprised of parts capable of navigating distinct problem spaces, a feature of "agential materials" that exceeds current simulation capabilities.

threads.narrative: This thread investigates specific mechanisms—such as latent problem-solving in simple algorithms and specific network constraints—that allow biological systems to outperform standard simulations. It moves from identifying unique biological constraints to demonstrating how minimal models can hint at, but not yet fully replicate, the "unexpected competencies" found in living systems.

threads.name: Agential Competency and Information Processing

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Establishes a theoretical model viewing morphogenesis as active information processing (Bayesian inference) where systems minimize uncertainty.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Proposes mathematical frameworks for closed-loop control, demonstrating how tissues monitor states and error-correct towards specific goals.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Synthesizes the view of tissues as "agential materials" that possess multiscale competency to navigate physiological and evolutionary landscapes.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from viewing development as a hardwired script to understanding it as an information-processing event. It moves from modeling morphogenesis as statistical inference to formalizing closed-loop control systems, culminating in the concept of tissues as agents that actively compete and cooperate to solve morphological problems.

threads.name: Goal-Directed Morphological Correction

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that tissues possess an innate ability to dynamically adjust and correct their shape and location following significant structural perturbation.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
