milestones.finding: Provides empirical evidence that developmental systems exchange information (Calcium) and metabolic resources (ATP) to overcome constraints and stressors.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence supporting the claim that tissues and organs are not passive but actively strive for specific outcomes. It highlights the capacity for self-repair and structural correction, as well as the sharing of information and metabolic resources (ATP) to navigate developmental constraints.

threads.name: Bioelectric Basis of Cellular Memory

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes that non-neural cells exhibit memory and signaling impulses via long-term stable changes in bioelectric states, historically considered neural-specific.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Demonstrates how evolution exploited somatic bioelectrics in homogeneous cell sheets to coordinate information for body positioning in developmental morphospace.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies standing patterns of resting potentials in non-neural tissue as a functional memory that guides collective behavior and gene expression.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery that bioelectricity is not unique to neurons but is a fundamental mechanism for memory and information processing in all cells. It progresses from identifying bioelectric memory in non-neural cells to establishing these networks as the evolutionary precursor (and functional equivalent) of neural cognitive systems, operating on developmental timescales.

threads.name: Scaling Cognition via Intercellular Coupling

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes a framework where gap-junctional coupling expands the spatial and temporal perception of single cells, creating a larger computational 'Self' similar to neural networks.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Analyzes neurons specifically as measurement devices within a hierarchy, suggesting their computational functions rely on physical principles applicable to other cellular remodeling processes.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Unifies neural and pre-neural intelligence by equating the neural navigation of 3D space with the non-neural navigation of anatomical morphospace.

threads.narrative: This theoretical thread builds the argument that cognition is scale-free and dependent on the coupling of agents rather than specific cell types. It moves from defining the computational boundaries of cellular aggregates to unifying the behavior of neurons and non-neural cells under the umbrella of collective intelligence, differing primarily in the space (physical vs. morphological) and timescale in which they operate.

threads.name: Generalizing Cellular Information Processing

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Challenges the neuron-centric view by showing that basic cellular physiology in diverse tissues implements information processing traditionally ascribed only to brains.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Argues for shifting focus from neurons to a general class of 'agents,' such as immune cells, which perform parallel processing tasks.

threads.narrative: This thread represents a cross-domain generalization effort to reclassify all cells as cognitive agents. It questions the exclusivity of neural processing by highlighting similar computational capabilities in immune and general physiological systems, supporting the claim that neurons are specialized, not unique, in their functions.

threads.name: Goal-Directed Repair Capabilities

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that tadpoles with experimentally scrambled faces spontaneously correct their anatomy, suggesting an innate, adjustable target morphology.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Cited the repair of scrambled anatomical features as evidence of decision-making and problem-solving in non-neural tissue.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Used these repair capabilities to argue that morphogenesis is not hardwired but requires cells to cooperate toward outcomes in morphospace.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the experimental basis for the claim: the observation that embryos can solve novel anatomical problems (like scrambled organs) to reach a target shape. This moves from the initial observation of 'self-correction' to the interpretation of this behavior as non-neural decision-making and problem-solving.

threads.name: Morphogenesis as Computational Cognition

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Distinguished regulative development from simple self-organization, emphasizing the ability to reach goal states despite starting deviations.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Framed developmental biology through the lens of 'active inference,' suggesting cells minimize prediction errors to achieve target shapes.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Modeled the self-assembly of anatomy as being functionally similar to computational sorting algorithms traversing a problem space.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Synthesized these views into a framework of 'agential materials' that possess pattern homeostatic properties and multiscale competency.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from viewing development as a chemical reaction to viewing it as a cognitive computation. Researchers developed models (Active Inference, sorting algorithms) to explain how cells navigate 'morphospace' to solve anatomical problems.

threads.name: Bioelectric Basis of Cellular Memory

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Proposed non-neural bioelectric networks as the specific physical medium that processes information and decisions in somatic tissues.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectricity as the 'cognitive glue' that stores morphogenetic memories, such as the specific anatomical layout required during regeneration.

threads.narrative: While the other threads establish behavior and theory, this thread identifies the physiological mechanism—bioelectricity—that allows cells to store 'memories' of target shapes. It links the abstract concept of cellular memory to a concrete biological process similar to neural signaling.

threads.name: Establishing the Non-Neural Computational Layer

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that non-neural bioelectric networks possess essential computational features (weights, biases) typically associated with neural networks.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalized developmental bioelectricity as a "unique computational layer" distinct from genetics and biomechanics that offers a tractable entry point for control.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Refined the concept of bioelectricity as "cognitive glue" that enables adaptive information processing regardless of scale.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the formalization of bioelectricity from a mere signaling mechanism to a privileged computational interface. It moves from initial modeling of somatic networks to a broader framework (TAME) that defines this layer as the driver of adaptive problem-solving in non-neural tissue.

threads.name: Generalizing Cognition Beyond Neurons

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposed that somatic tissues hold "pattern memories" and that bioelectric codes can be extracted similarly to brain measurements.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Generalized neural computation to cellular levels, identifying bioelectric integration as a mechanism existing from bacterial biofilms to humans.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Argued for a functionalist perspective where cognition is substrate-independent, rejecting the necessity of neural tissue for sentience.

threads.narrative: This evidence thread collects cross-domain findings to support the claim that cognition is not exclusive to brains. It highlights the universality of bioelectric signaling strategies, showing that the mechanisms for integrating information across distance are conserved from microbes to multicellular organisms.

threads.name: Scaling of Cognitive Competency

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified non-neural bioelectricity as a system that works alongside gene networks to manage developmental complexity.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Described how this computational layer allows cellular collectives to expand their "cognitive light cone" to predict and manage larger spatiotemporal states.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the evolutionary utility of the proposed computational layer. It explains how bioelectricity acts as the mechanism that allows simple cellular competencies to scale up into the complex, macroscopic problem-solving capabilities of multicellular organisms.

threads.name: Bioelectric Hardware of Somatic Computation

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes that bioelectricity, implemented by ion channel and gap junction "hardware," is evolutionarily selected to run the flexible software of life.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly defines the "hardware of the brain" as ion channels and controllable synapses (gap junctions), extending this computational architecture to non-neural somatic cells.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Frames bioelectric states determined by ion channels as the "cognitive glue" and network architecture that enables scaling from physiology to mind.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for the claim, formally equating biological structures (ion channels and gap junctions) with computational hardware. It traces the conceptual development from viewing these structures merely as physiological regulators to understanding them as the physical substrate for information processing and pattern memory in non-neural tissues.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Cellular Bistability and Logic

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric memory: modeling resting potential bistability in amphibian embryos and mammalian cells
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that non-neural cells can maintain stable, switchable voltage states (bistability) via specific ion channels, functioning similarly to memory transistors.

milestones.paper_title: HCN2 Rescues brain defects by enforcing endogenous voltage pre-patterns
milestones.finding: Applies kinetic models of voltage sensitivity to show how enforcing specific bioelectric states can rescue morphological defects, validating the functional utility of the "switch" mechanism.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Formalizes the transistor analogy by modeling non-neural cells as logic gates within a "Bioelectric Network Model," showing how ion channels enable somatic computation.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the specific mechanisms that make ion channels function like transistors: the ability to store state (bistability) and process logic. It moves from the discovery of memory states in individual cells to computational modeling of how these states are integrated to control complex biological outcomes.

threads.name: Gap Junctions as Information Circuitry

milestones.paper_title: A Novel Method for Inducing Nerve Growth via Modulation of Host Resting Potential: Gap Junction-Mediated and Serotonergic Signaling Mechanisms
milestones.finding: Shows that signaling molecules move between cells through gap junctions along voltage gradients, establishing the "wiring" that connects bioelectric components.

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Generalizes the role of gap junctions as a primitive analogue to neural synapses, enabling long-distance, circuit-like communication in non-neural tissues.

threads.narrative: If ion channels are transistors, this thread provides evidence for the "wires" and "circuits" necessary to utilize them. It highlights the progression of understanding gap junctions not just as pores, but as dynamic, voltage-sensitive connectors that enable the network-level properties described in the claim.

threads.name: Bioelectricity as Universal Cognitive Mechanism

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Identifies that tissues other than neurons possess the ability to conduct signaling impulses, a fundamental requirement for cognitive dynamics.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes developmental bioelectricity as the driver that allows somatic cells to form multicellular 'selves' and exhibit scale-free cognition.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Demonstrates how bioelectric networks serve as the mechanism enabling single cells to scale up physiological goals into complex cognitive functions.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of bioelectricity as the shared physical mechanism allowing both neurons and non-neuronal cells to process information. It progresses from the initial observation that non-neural tissues are excitable to a comprehensive model where bioelectric networks underpin cognition across all biological scales.

threads.name: Substrate-Independent Cognitive Theory

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes the principle of 'implementation-independence,' arguing that cognitive algorithms function regardless of the biological medium implementing them.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Expands the cognitive framework to include 'smart' information processing in immune cells, challenging the brain-centric view of mental processes.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Argues that while academia distinguishes between neuroscience and developmental biology, nature itself makes few distinctions between the mechanisms of neural and somatic systems.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical shift away from neurocentrism toward a view of cognition as a fundamental property of living systems. It builds a framework where 'thinking' is defined by computational capability rather than the presence of neurons, validated by the functional similarities found in immune and somatic cells.

threads.name: Bioelectric Mechanism of Morphospace Navigation

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that non-neural bioelectric networks perform information processing and decision-making during anatomical development.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identifies somatic bioelectricity as the mechanism evolution exploited to allow cell groups to coordinate body configuration in developmental morphospace.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Establishes an isomorphism between neural navigation of 3D space and somatic bioelectric navigation of anatomical morphospace.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of bioelectricity as the physical substrate for cellular "thinking." It moves from establishing that non-neural networks compute information to explicitly framing this computation as the navigation of an anatomical space, parallel to how brains navigate physical space.

threads.name: Computational Modeling of Regulative Development

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Argues that standard bottom-up emergence models cannot explain regulative development, which requires goal-directed agents correcting toward a target state.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Applies the 'active inference' framework to explain how embryonic cells cooperate and compete to minimize deviation from a target morphology.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Validates the problem-solving analogy by successfully modeling morphogenesis as a computational sorting task within morphospace.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the computational theory required to view development as a problem-solving task. It progresses from identifying the limitations of simple self-organization to applying formal computational frameworks like active inference and sorting algorithms to describe how cells achieve anatomical goals.

threads.name: Scaling of Cognitive Light Cones

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Observes that memory, anticipation, and problem-solving capabilities scale up from single cells to the emergence of Metazoa.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: De-centers the neuron by positing that cells generally are the fundamental agential units of biological processing.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of the 'cognitive light cone,' describing how cellular collectives enlarge their ability to pursue goals in larger spatio-temporal scales.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the evolutionary rationale for the claim. It frames the "thinking" of embryos not as a metaphor, but as a scalar expansion of basic cellular cognition, where collective agents (tissues/organs) gain the ability to measure and predict states in anatomical space.

threads.name: Modeling Bioelectric Computation and Memory

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric memory: modeling resting potential bistability in amphibian embryos and mammalian cells
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that specific combinations of ion channels can create bistable states, effectively functioning as stable bioelectric memory storage similar to electronic flip-flops.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Formalized how non-neural cells connected by gap junctions can implement boolean logic gates and truth tables, validating the computational capacity of bioelectric networks.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the 'transistor' analogy by mathematically proving that biological ion channels can implement fundamental computational primitives. The research progresses from establishing how cells store state information (memory) to modeling how interconnected networks perform complex logic operations.

threads.name: Voltage Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Particle tracking model of electrophoretic morphogen movement reveals stochastic dynamics of embryonic gradient
milestones.finding: Established that gap junction gating is regulated by voltage, providing the physical mechanism for how bioelectric states control molecular flow.

milestones.paper_title: A Novel Method for Inducing Nerve Growth via Modulation of Host Resting Potential: Gap Junction-Mediated and Serotonergic Signaling Mechanisms
milestones.finding: Experimentally demonstrated that modulating resting potential (Vmem) directs long-range signaling and nerve growth, proving the functional output of the bioelectric 'circuit'.

milestones.paper_title: HCN2 Rescues brain defects by enforcing endogenous voltage pre-patterns
milestones.finding: Used a specific ion channel (HCN2) to enforce voltage patterns that repaired brain defects, showing that 'accessing' these bioelectric states can override genetic defects.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the experimental evidence that voltage-sensitive conductances (the biological transistors) actually control biological structure. It moves from understanding the gating mechanism to successfully manipulating these mechanisms to induce repair and growth in living organisms.

threads.name: The Cognitive Bioelectric Framework

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposed that somatic bioelectrics serve as 'pattern memories' and that computational science must expand beyond neurons to understand diverse cognitive systems.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Argued that bioelectricity acts as the 'cognitive glue' enabling evolutionary scaling, generalizing the transistor-like properties of ion channels to a universal principle of biological cognition.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical generalization of the claim, moving from specific mechanisms to a broad framework. It posits that the 'platonic space of mathematical truths' accessed by ion channels underpins the cognitive capabilities of all biological systems, not just brains.

threads.name: Evolutionary Conservation of Bioelectric Machinery

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric memory: modeling resting potential bistability in amphibian embryos and mammalian cells
milestones.finding: Established that bioelectric signaling and memory mechanisms are not restricted to neurons but exist in somatic cells using the same ion channels.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Articulated that the brain's hardware (ion channels, gap junctions) is highly conserved and evolutionarily ancient, appearing in all body cells.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Generalized neural computation to cellular computation, noting neurons evolved from cells that already possessed electrical synapses and excitability.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the recognition that the molecular components used for neural signaling (ion channels, electrical synapses) are not unique to neurons. The research progresses from identifying these components in somatic cells to establishing a theoretical framework where neurons are viewed as specialized versions of an ancient, ubiquitous cellular signaling architecture.

threads.name: Somatic Bioelectricity as Information Processing

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Proposed that somatic cells form "computational tissues" where bioelectric states act as information networks guiding self-assembly and regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Exploring Instructive Physiological Signaling with the Bioelectric Tissue Simulation Engine
milestones.finding: Developed the BETSE simulation engine to quantitatively study how tissue-level electric fields and resting potential gradients guide cell behavior.

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that every cell possesses a membrane potential used for long-distance communication to regulate gene expression, similar to neural networks.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the functional role of bioelectricity outside the nervous system, moving from the concept of "computational tissues" to specific tools for simulation and evidence of long-distance communication. It supports the claim by showing that non-neural cells actively process information and regulate behavior via electrical networks, largely differing from neurons only in timescale.

threads.name: Scaling the Self via Bioelectricity

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Proposes that non-neural cells communicating via gap junctions could store information and make decisions analogously to neural networks.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Identifies gap junctional networks as the mechanism that coordinates cells into "unified Selves" with shared goals.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly models how gap junctions allow the "borders of the Self" to expand, merging individual cell data into a morphogenetic collective intelligence.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Concludes that sharing cellular memories via gap junctions establishes higher-order individuals by integrating information.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical development of the "cognitive glue" hypothesis. It evolves from an initial speculation that tissue networks compute like brains to a formalized framework where gap junctions physically merge the information states of cells, erasing individual data ownership to create a unified, higher-level "Self."

threads.name: Mechanisms of Intercellular Signal Transport

milestones.paper_title: Particle tracking model of electrophoretic morphogen movement reveals stochastic dynamics of embryonic gradient
milestones.finding: Establishes that intracellular movement of signals through cytoplasmic bridges is a critical component of developmental patterning.

milestones.paper_title: A Novel Method for Inducing Nerve Growth via Modulation of Host Resting Potential: Gap Junction-Mediated and Serotonergic Signaling Mechanisms
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that signaling molecules like 5-HT can move between cells through gap junctions driven by voltage gradients.

milestones.paper_title: Beyond Neurons: Long Distance Communication in Development and Cancer
milestones.finding: Validates that gap junctions allow non-neural cells to establish stable electrical states, functioning primitively like neural synapses.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the biophysical mechanics that enable the claim. It progresses from modeling particle movement to experimentally verifying that gap junctions allow specific signaling molecules and electrical states to pass between cells, providing the physical hardware required for data sharing and collective decision-making.

threads.name: Biophysical Mechanisms of Bioelectric Memory

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric memory: modeling resting potential bistability in amphibian embryos and mammalian cells
milestones.finding: Modeled somatic cells as bistable switches (flip-flops) that can maintain specific voltage ranges and be reversibly rewritten by transient currents.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalized the 'hardware' definition where ion channels set electrical states and gap junctions propagate them, analogous to computational memory.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the physical plausibility of the claim by modeling how non-neural cells can act as volatile memory storage. It progresses from demonstrating mathematical bistability in voltage potentials to defining the specific cellular hardware (ion channels) that allows biological tissues to hold information in stable dynamical states.

threads.name: Evolutionary Scaling of Bioelectric Computation

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposed that bioelectric hardware implementation predates nervous systems, deriving from first principles of information theory rather than just neural adaptation.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectric networks as an ancient 'cognitive glue' allowing coherent computation and state maintenance from unicellular ancestors to complex multicellular bodies.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the claim by placing it in a broader evolutionary context, arguing that the ability to hold bioelectrical states is not a recent neural invention but a fundamental property of cellular life. It traces the development of this concept from a theoretical boundary definition to a universal mechanism for biological cognition.

threads.name: Biological Networks as Cognitive Agents

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposes that gene regulatory networks (GRNs) exhibit Hebbian plasticity and develop associative memory of past phenotypes.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Conceptualizes biochemical nodes as "hidden layers" with feedback loops that maintain state after transient stimuli, enabling memory.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Validates the perspective of GRNs as agents capable of substrate-independent behaviors by mapping their input-output transformations.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical evolution of viewing chemical networks not just as reactive pathways, but as cognitive systems capable of learning. It moves from identifying neural-like plasticity in genetic regulation to formally modeling these networks as agents with memory and decision-making capabilities.

threads.name: Dynamical Stability and Attractors

milestones.paper_title: The nonlinearity of regulation in biological networks
milestones.finding: Introduces regulatory nonlinearity as a metric to characterize how Boolean networks encode information and maintain robustness.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates computational methods to reveal the specific set of steady states (attractors) a network can reach based on initial conditions.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the physics and mathematics of the claim, specifically how networks function as dynamical systems. It progresses from characterizing the nonlinearity required for complex information encoding to empirically mapping the stable "steady states" that represent the system's memory.

threads.name: Bioelectric State as Physical Memory

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Identified that non-neural cells implement memory regarding somatic position via long-term stable changes in bioelectric state.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposed that bioelectric circuits serve as the non-neural material substrate storing distributed, re-writable pattern memories.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Confirmed that standing patterns of resting potential instructively determine morphology, acting literally as the memory of the collective intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the mechanism by which physical configurations store memory outside of the brain. It progresses from early observations of bioelectricity in single-cell physiology to the definitive characterization of bioelectric networks as the writable physical medium for morphogenetic memory.

threads.name: Scaling of Morphogenetic Competency

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Described how evolution exploited cellular collectives to position body configurations in morphospace using bioelectric information.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalized the concept of the "cognitive light cone," explaining how cellular collectives enlarge their spatial-temporal memory capacity.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Argued for a generalized class of agential materials to decouple cognitive processing from strictly neural substrates.

threads.narrative: This thread outlines the theoretical expansion of memory from simple storage to complex problem-solving in "agential materials." It demonstrates how physical cellular configurations allow biological systems to scale their cognitive horizon (light cone) to maintain anatomical homeostasis and evolutionary adaptations.

threads.name: Dynamical Stability of Bioelectric Memory

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric memory: modeling resting potential bistability in amphibian embryos and mammalian cells
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that somatic cells can occupy multiple stable voltage levels and switch between them like digital memory elements.

milestones.paper_title: Exploring Instructive Physiological Signaling with the Bioelectric Tissue Simulation Engine
milestones.finding: Characterized resting potential as a dynamical attractor state that remains stable despite variable initial conditions or transient perturbations.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified these bioelectric states as distributed, re-writable pattern memories that store information about target morphology.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the mechanical understanding of how bioelectricity functions as 'volatile RAM.' It progresses from modeling the bistability of voltage states in cells to validating their dynamical stability as attractors, and finally categorizing them as re-writable memory media distinct from fixed anatomy.

threads.name: Bioelectric Software vs. Ion Channel Hardware

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Formalized the distinction where ion channels serve as protein hardware while bioelectricity acts as flexible, computational software.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposed that bioelectric networks store 'latent' information (counterfactual representations) that cannot be observed by inspecting the physical hardware alone.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Expanded the framework to describe bioelectric networks as the 'cognitive glue' that runs coherent algorithms on top of ancient cellular substrates.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical analogy between bioelectricity and computer architecture. It establishes the concept that the 'energetic state' (software) carries information independent of the 'hardware' (ion channels), explaining why structural analysis (like X-rays) cannot reveal the system's informational content.

threads.name: Agential Materials and Control

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes that biological systems solve the "inverse problem" of control through multiscale autonomy, offering a model for engineering complex systems.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Argues that "biological software" encapsulates chaotic relationships into goal-seeking modules, simplifying control via top-down goal states.

milestones.paper_title: Classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis: Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that distributed local agents (modeled by sorting algorithms) possess inherent robustness and handle reliability without central complexity.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical argument that biology avoids the complexity of direct bottom-up control by using "agential materials"—components with inherent competency and goal-seeking behavior. It progresses from identifying the "inverse problem" in control theory to proposing a biological architecture of modular goals, and validating these concepts through minimal algorithmic models.

threads.name: Bioelectric Somatic Computation

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectrical pathways as a control layer for tissue patterning and highlights the need for algorithmic models to understand these dynamics.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Formalizes how non-neural bioelectric networks implement memory, long-range coordination, and decision-making functions useful for anatomical control.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Suggests viewing morphogenetic processes as specific computational tasks to design synthetic biology architectures that incorporate simple intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery and formalization of computation in non-neural biological tissues. It moves from the initial identification of bioelectricity as a patterning mechanism to specific models of "somatic computation," culminating in proposals for synthetic architectures that mimic these biological feedback loops.

threads.name: Active Inference as Biological Logic

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Modeled cells as information-processing agents that update prior beliefs via evidence accumulation to drive morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: A free energy principle for generic quantum systems.
milestones.finding: Extended the concept of active inference to generic quantum systems, framing it as a fundamental indicator of cognition.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Proposed active inference as a unified account where agents minimize surprise to reach preferred morphological states, linking development to computational psychiatry.

threads.narrative: This thread formalizes the claim's core mechanism by establishing active inference and Bayesian belief updating as the mathematical logic governing biological organization. It progresses from applying Bayesian statistics to cell dynamics, generalizing the physics of these systems, and finally unifying them under a framework of minimizing surprise to achieve specific goals.

threads.name: Proto-Cognitive Decision Making

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that active inference principles scale downwards from large networks to individual synapses, selecting for informative activity.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Investigated minimal "proto-cognitive" functions and stochastic decision-making in multicellular contexts like regeneration and cancer, distinct from human-level cognition.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: utilized AI tools to uncover diverse behavioral competencies and decision-making capabilities within gene regulatory network models.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the claim that biological systems make decisions on limited information by exploring these capacities across different scales and substrates. The research moves from synaptic scaling to collective tissue intelligence and finally to computational models of gene networks, illustrating how imperfect, heuristic decision-making is ubiquitous in biology.

threads.name: Active Inference in Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Proposed that cellular pattern formation is driven by Bayesian belief updating where agents minimize variational free energy.

milestones.paper_title: A free energy principle for generic quantum systems.
milestones.finding: Extended the theoretical boundary of active inference, positioning it as a fundamental cognitive principle applicable to generic physical systems.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Formalized how cells act as agents generating preferred sensations to achieve specific target morphologies by minimizing surprise.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical backbone of the claim, moving from the initial hypothesis that morphogenesis resembles Bayesian inference to formally modeling cells as agents that minimize surprise to guide development.

threads.name: Automated Discovery of Network Behaviors

milestones.paper_title: Inferring Regulatory Networks from Experimental Morphological Phenotypes: A Computational Method Reverse-Engineers Planarian Regeneration
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that computational methods could reverse-engineer the regulatory logic behind complex regenerative decisions.

milestones.paper_title: The nonlinearity of regulation in biological networks
milestones.finding: Analyzed the nonlinear properties of Boolean networks, establishing the mathematical constraints under which biological decision-making operates.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Utilized AI tools to reveal that even standard biological networks possess diverse, context-sensitive behavioral competencies.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the methodological evolution of understanding biological decisions, progressing from specific reverse-engineering of regeneration to broad AI-driven discovery of behavioral competencies in genetic networks.

threads.name: Unifying Biological Intelligence

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: framed biological agents (cells) as information processors that direct exploration based on internal active states.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Integrated stochastic decision-making and information processing into a unified framework of collective intelligence across biological scales.

threads.narrative: This thread illustrates the generalization of the claim, connecting specific cellular decision-making mechanisms to a broader concept of collective intelligence that unifies biology across different scales and substrates.

threads.name: Neuro-Somatic Pharmacological Isomorphism

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Identifies that psychoactive drugs act as teratogens, suggesting neural and somatic systems share signaling pathways.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes using "rewards and punishments" (nutrients/drugs) to control anatomy, framing regenerative medicine as behavioral shaping.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that dopamine antagonists induce predicted anatomical defects by reducing sensory precision in non-neural morphogenetic systems.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the "somatic psychiatry" claim by demonstrating that non-neural tissues possess neurotransmitter receptors and respond to psychiatric drugs with morphological changes. The research progresses from observing the teratogenic effects of psychoactive substances to formally applying computational psychiatry models (active inference) to predict and control somatic development.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Long-range neural and gap junction protein-mediated cues control polarity during planarian regeneration.
milestones.finding: Establishes that regeneration is orchestrated by long-range, neural-like gap junction signaling rather than just local cues.

milestones.paper_title: HDAC Activity Is Required during Xenopus Tail Regeneration
milestones.finding: Identifies specific bioelectric and epigenetic states that enable differentiated cells to access regenerative programs.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Synthesizes bioelectric signaling as a mechanism of "collective intelligence," where cells navigate anatomical morphospace similar to organisms navigating 3D space.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the mechanistic basis for the claim by showing that somatic tissues use bioelectric networks—functionally similar to brains—to store pattern memories and coordinate regeneration. It establishes the biological hardware that allows tissue repair to be treated as a cognitive, decision-making process amenable to psychiatric-style interventions.

threads.name: Shift from Molecular Micromanagement to State Correction

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes that biological outcomes are driven by high-level bioelectric computations rather than just low-level molecular interactions, suggesting therapeutic targets exist above the level of symptoms.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates via AI analysis that "stimuli-based interventions" can shape system behavior robustly without the need to micromanage every molecular state (treating the symptom).

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical move away from treating biological systems as simple machines requiring constant maintenance (symptom suppression). It advances the argument that interventions should target the system's computational state to achieve lasting stability, rather than micromanaging molecular pathways.

threads.name: Electroceuticals as Curative Interventions

milestones.paper_title: Inverse drug screens: a rapid and inexpensive method for implicating molecular targets
milestones.finding: Establishes a methodology for identifying existing drugs that can be repurposed to target ion channels and alter large-scale biological patterning.

milestones.paper_title: Ion Channel and Neurotransmitter Modulators as Electroceutical Approaches to the Control of Cancer
milestones.finding: Positions ion channel modulators as an alternative to conventional chemotherapy (which often fails to cure), aiming to restore normal growth control mechanisms.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
milestones.finding: Shows that biological populations possess innate collective repair mechanisms (CEMA) that can be activated to permanently correct defects, supporting a curative rather than maintenance model.

threads.narrative: This thread provides evidence for a specific class of interventions (electroceuticals) that operate differently than standard maintenance drugs. By targeting bioelectric signaling and innate repair mechanisms, these studies suggest a pathway toward restoring healthy system states (cures) rather than suppressing symptoms.

threads.name: Probability-Based Target Validation

milestones.paper_title: Inverse drug screens: a rapid and inexpensive method for implicating molecular targets
milestones.finding: Proposes a hierarchical strategy of using multiple drugs with shared targets to statistically filter out side effects and identify the true molecular driver.

milestones.paper_title: A Second-Generation Device for Automated Training and Quantitative Behavior Analyses of Molecularly-Tractable Model Organisms
milestones.finding: Introduces automated behavioral analysis systems to enable the high-throughput screening necessary to robustly validate phenotypic effects amidst potential noise.

threads.narrative: In response to the difficulty of clean low-level interactions, this thread traces the development of methodological frameworks that rely on accumulating probabilistic evidence and high-throughput phenotypic screening to manage and mitigate side effects.

threads.name: Non-Neuronal Cellular Habituation

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposes that drug tolerance is a form of cellular desensitization, representing a basic cognitive memory element present in somatic cells.

milestones.paper_title: Optogenetically induced cellular habituation in non-neuronal cells
milestones.finding: Provides experimental proof of concept that non-neuronal cells exhibit habituation behaviors to repetitive stimulation, mirroring organism-level learning.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the claim by moving from the theoretical proposition that single cells possess memory relevant to drug tolerance (desensitization) to direct experimental evidence of habituation in non-neuronal systems.

threads.name: Chemical Networks as Cognitive Agents

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Establishes that neurotransmitter pathways function as ancient control mechanisms for memory and learning outside of the nervous system.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the view that Gene Regulatory Networks (GRNs) should be modeled as cognitive agents rather than hardwired mechanisms.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that viewing biological networks as agents allows AI to discover interventions that shape behavior, offering a new approach to therapeutics.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical basis for understanding chemical pathways (like GRNs) as learning systems, progressing from evolutionary arguments to a formal framework and finally to AI-driven application for drug discovery.

threads.name: Limitations of Structural Interventions

milestones.paper_title: Ion Channel and Neurotransmitter Modulators as Electroceutical Approaches to the Control of Cancer
milestones.finding: Highlights that conventional cancer therapies (chemotherapy/radiation) have major drawbacks and often fail to control metastasis.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Critiques therapeutic strategies that treat pathways as "simple machines" by adding/removing nodes, arguing they fail to address the emergent nature of physiology.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical critique of modern pharmacological approaches. It suggests that interventions focusing on structural rewiring or symptomatic suppression (treating the body as a simple machine) are insufficient for complex physiological dysregulation, supporting the claim's premise that such methods do not effect a true cure.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Phenotype

milestones.paper_title: Early, H+-V-ATPase-dependent proton flux is necessary for consistent left-right patterning of non-mammalian vertebrates
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that upstream bioelectric states (proton flux) control complex morphological patterning, establishing a target level above the gene/protein node.

milestones.paper_title: Inverse drug screens: a rapid and inexpensive method for implicating molecular targets
milestones.finding: Establishes a methodology for using small molecule drugs to identify and validate these bioelectric control targets in vivo.

milestones.paper_title: Ion Channel and Neurotransmitter Modulators as Electroceutical Approaches to the Control of Cancer
milestones.finding: Shows that repurposing drugs to target ion channels (e.g., Prozac) can inhibit tumor cell survival, offering a mechanism to correct the physiological state.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the experimental counter-narrative to symptomatic treatment, showing that modulating bioelectric states can fundamentally alter biological outcomes (from development to cancer). This supports the view that targeting the system's control state, rather than just its symptoms, is necessary for effective correction.

threads.name: Physiological Reprogramming vs Toxicity

milestones.paper_title: Early, H+-V-ATPase-dependent proton flux is necessary for consistent left-right patterning of non-mammalian vertebrates
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that manipulating high-level physiological parameters (proton flux) effectively controls complex morphological patterning.

milestones.paper_title: Ion Channel and Neurotransmitter Modulators as Electroceutical Approaches to the Control of Cancer
milestones.finding: Proposed that physiological reprogramming of tumors can avoid the toxic side effects and compensatory growth associated with low-level chemotherapy.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the concept that interacting at a high physiological level (bioelectrics) allows for the normalization of biological states, offering a solution to the toxicity and side effects inherent in reductive, low-level molecular interventions.

threads.name: Collective Robustness vs Molecular Fragility

milestones.paper_title: Inverse drug screens: a rapid and inexpensive method for implicating molecular targets
milestones.finding: Highlighted the methodological problem of low specificity and overlapping targets when attempting to interact with specific molecular components.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
milestones.finding: Showed that collective, high-level signaling networks (Calcium/ATP) allow systems to resist and correct for low-level molecular disruptions (teratogens).

threads.narrative: This research arc contrasts the messiness and lack of specificity found at the molecular target level with the discovery that biological systems utilize collective, high-level signaling to ensure robustness and mitigate side effects.

threads.name: Scale-Free Cognition Framework

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposes a pragmatic, engineering approach to cognition in non-neural systems, moving beyond philosophy to prediction and control.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept that information propagation in somatic networks is not fundamentally different from neural signaling, enabling scale-free cognition.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Frames morphogenetic control as a form of collective intelligence where systems can be manipulated via goal-regulating behaviors rather than micromanagement.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Argues that looking at the level of particles/chemistry misses the platform necessary to observe and manipulate system intelligence.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for treating biological systems as cognitive agents at multiple scales. It progresses from defining non-neural cognition to framing physiology as 'collective intelligence' that should be targeted at the level of goals rather than chemical pathways.

threads.name: Engineering Network Competencies

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Suggests viewing morphogenesis as specific computational tasks and proposes architectures for incorporating intelligence into synthetic constructs.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric networks as the specific mechanism enabling the scaling of cognitive goals from cells to whole organisms.

milestones.paper_title: AI-driven automated discovery tools reveal diverse behavioral competencies of biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates via AI that molecular networks possess innate navigation competencies to reach homeostatic states, which can be exploited for therapeutic goals.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the operational mechanisms required to implement the claim. It moves from modeling biological processes as computational tasks to identifying bioelectricity as the control medium and finally using AI to discover how to exploit these innate network competencies for medical outcomes.

threads.name: Evolutionary Continuity of Cellular Computation

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Establishes a framework where developmental bioelectricity is defined as a unique computational layer separate from gene networks.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Generalizes neural computation to cellular computation, noting that neurons evolved from cells already possessing electrical features.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies somatic bioelectricity as the "ancient cognitive glue" that pre-dated brains for processing information and making decisions.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from viewing bioelectricity as exclusive to neurons to recognizing it as a fundamental, ancient property of all cells. It posits an evolutionary continuity where neural mechanisms are specialized adaptations of general cellular electrical networks used for somatic computation.

threads.name: Encoding Target Morphologies via Bioelectricity

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Proposes models for how non-neural bioelectric networks perform computation to achieve structural goals during embryogenesis and regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates through Planaria regeneration that bioelectric networks encode a reprogrammable "target morphology" distinct from the genome.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Frames the regeneration process as a navigation of "anatomical morphospace" where bioelectric memories guide the system toward a goal shape.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the specific function of these networks: storing and processing the "goal shape" of the organism. It moves from modeling somatic computation to providing experimental evidence (in Planaria) that these networks actively maintain a representation of anatomical target states that guides regeneration.

threads.name: Validation of Negligible Senescence

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Establishes that planaria can dynamically regulate body size (degrowth) and regenerate reproductive organs, defying typical aging constraints.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Explicitly categorizes planaria as "immortal at the level of the individual," stating they have conquered aging through continuous tissue regeneration.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the validation of the claim that planaria do not age in the traditional sense. It moves from observations of their unique physiological plasticity—such as the ability to shrink and regenerate gonads—to modern categorizations of the species as biologically immortal.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Cellular Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Identifies neoblasts (adult stem cells) as the essential mechanism for constant tissue turnover and germ-cell specification required for potential immortality.

milestones.paper_title: Inhibition of Planar Cell Polarity Extends Neural Growth During Regeneration, Homeostasis, and Development
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that Planar Cell Polarity (PCP) pathways regulate the proliferation signals necessary to maintain specific tissues without uncontrolled growth.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Proposes biophysical and computational models to explain how anatomical homeostasis is maintained indefinitely against entropy.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the physiological machinery that enables planarian immortality. It progresses from identifying the stem cell population responsible for tissue renewal to investigating the molecular and biophysical signaling pathways that regulate this continuous growth and repair.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Regenerative Control

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Identified that specific bioelectric events, such as H+ pumping, are sufficient to induce regeneration in complex structures.

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that somatic cells function as computational tissues where bioelectric states can be written to guide self-assembly.

milestones.paper_title: HCN2 Rescues brain defects by enforcing endogenous voltage pre-patterns
milestones.finding: Validated that enforcing specific bioelectric pre-patterns can rescue complex morphological defects in the brain, confirming the causal role of these networks.

threads.narrative: This thread tracks the experimental progression from identifying simple ionic triggers for regeneration to manipulating complex bioelectric pre-patterns to control morphology. It validates that somatic cells utilize electrical networks to direct growth and repair, functioning similarly to neural control systems.

threads.name: Evolutionary Continuity of Bioelectricity

milestones.paper_title: Revisiting Burr and Northrop’s “The Electro-Dynamic Theory of Life” (1935)
milestones.finding: Re-contextualized historical data to argue that distributed electrical patterns in non-neural tissue are a fundamental property of life.

milestones.paper_title: When left does not seem right: epigenetic and bioelectric differences between left- and right-sided breast cancer
milestones.finding: asserted that evolution exploited bioelectric networks for morphogenesis in cell collectives long before the specialized evolution of neurons.

milestones.paper_title: Neurons as hierarchies of quantum reference frames
milestones.finding: Formalized the concept that neurons evolved from somatic cells, retaining and specializing the basic electrical mechanisms present in all cells.

threads.narrative: This narrative establishes the theoretical basis for the claim by linking modern findings to evolutionary history. It posits that neural computation is not unique but rather a specialized adaptation of ancient bioelectric signaling mechanisms inherent to all somatic cells.

threads.name: Modeling Somatic Computation

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Constructed the BioElectric Network (BEN) model to formally simulate how non-neural cells collectively make decisions during morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Expanded the network model to describe bioelectric networks as generic, reprogrammable problem-solving systems used by evolution.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the computational nature of the claim, moving from the conceptual idea of 'thinking tissues' to rigorous mathematical models (BEN) that explain how non-neural networks process information to achieve structural goals.

threads.name: Theoretical Evolution of Morphogenetic Goals

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposed the concept of 'somatic pattern memories' where bioelectric states encode goal patterns similarly to neural representations.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalized how gap junctions allow cellular collectives to scale 'goal states' and expand their cognitive horizon to maintain anatomical homeostasis.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Expanded the theory to describe how cellular collectives enlarge their 'cognitive light cone' to pursue specific target morphological states.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical development of bioelectricity as a carrier of morphological goals. It moves from the initial proposal of somatic pattern memory to a formalized framework where bioelectric networks allow cellular collectives to store and pursue complex anatomical target states.

threads.name: Mechanism of Rewritable Pattern Memories

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Developed the BioElectric Network (BEN) model to demonstrate how non-neural networks can computationally implement logic to facilitate morphogenesis.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectric circuits as the specific non-neural substrate that stores distributed, re-writable information about target morphology.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Validated the processing claim by showing that morphogenetic memories (such as planarian head count) can be experimentally rewritten to change the goal shape.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the mechanistic understanding of how bioelectric networks process shape information. It progresses from computational models of somatic decision-making to the experimental identification of these networks as re-writable media that actively maintain and process difference states between current and goal shapes.

threads.name: Anatomical Homeostasis Framework

milestones.paper_title: Inhibition of Planar Cell Polarity Extends Neural Growth During Regeneration, Homeostasis, and Development
milestones.finding: Highlights the necessity of regulating size and proportion during tissue growth to achieve a final structural pattern.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Frames regeneration as 'anatomical homeostasis,' where the organism actively remodels to restore a specific target body plan.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Proposes a 'collective intelligence' model where cell populations cooperate to remodel tissue toward a specific shape fidelity.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the conceptual evolution of regeneration from simple growth to 'anatomical homeostasis,' explaining how organisms actively remodel existing tissue to maintain global proportions. It progresses from identifying growth constraints to defining the system as one navigating an anatomical morphospace to reach a target shape.

threads.name: Polarity and Patterning Mechanisms

milestones.paper_title: Long-range neural and gap junction protein-mediated cues control polarity during planarian regeneration.
milestones.finding: Identifies long-range neural and gap junction cues as essential mechanisms for establishing the polarity required for proportional regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Inhibition of Planar Cell Polarity Extends Neural Growth During Regeneration, Homeostasis, and Development
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that Planar Cell Polarity pathways are critical for regulating the extent of tissue growth and stop signals.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Reviews the roles of Wnt signaling gradients and reaction-diffusion models in controlling anterior-posterior axial patterning.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the specific physiological and molecular signals that allow the organism to determine orientation and proportion. It tracks the discovery of bioelectric cues (gap junctions) and genetic pathways (PCP, Wnt) that provide the coordinate system for the shrinking and remodeling process described in the claim.

threads.name: Single-Cell Bottleneck Defining Individuality

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Proposes that the single-cell bottleneck necessitates bioelectric coordination to maintain the 'boundary of the self' against competition.

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Distinguishes 'obligate multicellularity' (bottlenecked lineages) as a rare evolutionary path leading to highly integrated individuals.

milestones.paper_title: Design for an Individual: Connectionist Approaches to the Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of individuality through connectionist models, showing how the bottleneck aligns functional integration.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical necessity of the single-cell bottleneck (the egg) in defining biological 'individuals' distinct from loose cellular societies. It argues that this compression forces the development of tight coordination mechanisms (like bioelectricity) to manage the subsequent decompression into a complex organism.

threads.name: Scaling of Basal Competencies

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes that cognition and decision-making capabilities exist at the cellular level, providing the substrate for the egg's potential.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Describes how basal cellular competencies do not disappear but scale up to create collective intelligence in the multicellular organism.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Demonstrates how higher-order entities formed through this process distort energy landscapes to harness subunit competencies for regulation.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the mechanism of the claim's 'compression process' by showing how the single cell (egg) contains basal competencies that are mathematically and biologically scaled up. It explains how the organism 'decompresses' this information by harnessing the problem-solving abilities of its constituent cells.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Shape Regeneration

milestones.paper_title: Long-range neural and gap junction protein-mediated cues control polarity during planarian regeneration.
milestones.finding: Identified that long-range neural cues and gap junctions are critical for establishing the correct polarity when fragments regenerate.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Argued that while molecular pathways are known, computational models are necessary to understand the dynamics that allow precise anatomical reconstruction.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Proposed bioelectric networks as the mechanism that enables the scaling of anatomical information, allowing fragments to rebuild the correct whole.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the search for the underlying mechanisms that allow a planarian fragment to 'know' what to build. It progresses from identifying specific physiological cues (gap junctions) to broader computational and bioelectric frameworks that explain anatomical homeostasis.

threads.name: Bio-inspired Resilient Systems

milestones.paper_title: Automated shapeshifting for function recovery in damaged robots
milestones.finding: Explicitly cited the record of planarian fragmentation (noting 279 pieces) to motivate the design of self-reconfiguring robots.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Linked the morphological plasticity of planaria to the field of morphological computation in robotics.

threads.narrative: This thread demonstrates how the specific claim of extreme regenerative capacity (cutting into hundreds of pieces) has been translated into engineering principles. It shows the movement from biological observation to application in creating resilient, shape-shifting robotic systems.

threads.name: Functional and Memory Restoration

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Established planarians as a model system possessing complex nervous systems and behavioral repertoires suitable for regeneration studies.

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
