milestones.finding: Reviewed evidence showing that planarians can regenerate not just tissue but also memories and learned behaviors after head loss.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the 'perfect little worm' aspect of the claim, confirming that regeneration extends beyond simple tissue regrowth. It highlights research showing that functional capacities, including behavior and memory, are successfully restored in the regenerated organism.

threads.name: Phenomenology of Anatomical Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: A Second-Generation Device for Automated Training and Quantitative Behavior Analyses of Molecularly-Tractable Model Organisms
milestones.finding: Establishes the fundamental observation that planaria can regenerate a complete, whole worm from only a small section of the adult body.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Frames this regenerative capacity as 'anatomical homeostasis,' where the organism continuously regenerates tissues to maintain a specific functional body plan.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the validation of the claim's premise: that planaria do not just grow new tissue, but actively maintain a specific whole-body form regardless of size. It moves from the basic observation of regeneration from fragments to the formal biological characterization of this process as anatomical homeostasis.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Shape Remodeling

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Identifies planaria as a critical model for understanding the specific molecular mechanisms of tissue turnover and stem cell regulation required for remodeling.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Highlights specific signaling pathways (Wnt/β-Catenin) and gradient models that act as the control system for anterior-posterior polarity during proportional regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Proposes that cells (neoblasts) work cooperatively to remodel tissue toward a specific target shape with high fidelity, framing regeneration as a navigation of 'anatomical morphospace'.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the 'how' behind the claim, moving from general molecular definitions to specific gradient theories, and finally to modern theories of collective cellular intelligence. It explains how the tissue 'knows' to shrink or grow to achieve the correct proportional shape.

threads.name: Physiological Dynamics of Degrowth

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Established that planarians proportionally reduce body size ("degrowth") and resorb organs when starved, then regenerate them upon feeding.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Framed these capabilities as "anatomical homeostasis," linking continuous tissue turnover to the animal's apparent immortality and functional plasticity.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the core observation that planarians can reversibly scale their body size based on nutrient availability. The research progresses from describing the physiological phenomena of "degrowth" and organ resorption to contextualizing these traits within a broader framework of biological immortality and anatomical homeostasis.

threads.name: Cellular Regulatory Mechanisms

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Identified that the processes of growth and degrowth are driven by well-regulated adult stem cell dynamics and cellular turnover.

milestones.paper_title: Inhibition of Planar Cell Polarity Extends Neural Growth During Regeneration, Homeostasis, and Development
milestones.finding: Proposed the Planar Cell Polarity (PCP) pathway as a molecular mechanism regulating cell size and proliferation to coordinate tissue-wide morphological changes.

threads.narrative: This thread investigates the biological machinery allowing planarians to shrink and expand. It moves from implicating general stem cell regulation to exploring specific molecular pathways, such as Planar Cell Polarity, that coordinate cell size and proliferation during whole-body scaling.

threads.name: Computational Models of Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Developed a bioelectric network model to simulate how non-neural somatic tissues process input stimuli to determine biological outcomes.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Reviewed computational approaches, including reaction-diffusion models, to explain how planaria maintain body plan control and polarity during dynamic size changes.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical effort to understand how a biological system computes and maintains its target morphology during drastic changes in scale. It highlights the shift toward using biophysical and computational models to explain the information processing underlying anatomical homeostasis.

threads.name: Target-Driven Morphostasis in Biology

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Proposes the concept of "morphostasis," framing regeneration as the maintenance of the specific target shape acquired during development.

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Experimentally demonstrates that developing embryos can correct induced structural perturbations, exhibiting the same goal-directedness typically associated with regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Explicitly classifies both embryogenesis and limb regeneration as "goal-directed activities" that robustly achieve specific anatomical outcomes despite varying starting conditions.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the conceptual and experimental equivalence of development and regeneration. It progresses from defining the theoretical framework of "morphostasis" (maintenance of target shape) to validating it experimentally in embryos that self-correct, culminating in a unified view of both processes as goal-directed morphological control.

threads.name: Computational Modeling of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Identifies the lack of and urgent need for cybernetic models to quantify what specific goals morphogenetic systems seek to maximize.

milestones.paper_title: Automated shapeshifting for function recovery in damaged robots
milestones.finding: Applies biological principles of regeneration—specifically cells working toward a large-scale goal—to design self-editing algorithms for robotics.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Formalizes the unification of development and regeneration by proposing a generative Bayesian model that describes both as inference problems.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the move from biological observation to formal computational descriptions. It begins by identifying the need for cybernetic explanations of pattern control and evolves into specific applications in robotics and mathematical frameworks (Bayesian inference) that treat development and regeneration as identical computational problems.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control Mechanisms

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric signals as a key component of the "morphogenetic field" responsible for maintaining anatomical integrity.

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Argues that reprogramming information-processing pathways (bioelectricity) is necessary to orchestrate both single cells and complex autonomous structures.

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Describes "somatic pattern memories" encoded in non-neural bioelectricity as the shared mechanism driving both initial embryogenesis and lifelong body maintenance.

threads.narrative: This thread focuses on the specific physiological machinery—bioelectricity—that underlies the claim. It links the initial assembly of the organism (development) with the maintenance and repair of structures (regeneration) by showing that both rely on the same non-neural bioelectric networks to store and execute pattern memories.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Depolarization Alters Phenotype, Maintains Plasticity of Predifferentiated Mesenchymal Stem Cells
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that bioelectric signaling (depolarization) can regulate cell differentiation and plasticity, suggesting a method for therapeutic regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Showed that manipulating voltage gradients can induce complex organs (like eyes) without specifying construction details, acting as a top-down control.

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Framed non-neural bioelectricity as "somatic pattern memory" required to maintain anatomical integrity against injury and senescence.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes bioelectricity as a primary control layer for regeneration. It moves from cellular-level plasticity modulation to tissue-level organ induction, positing that bioelectric networks store the "pattern memory" needed to guide regenerative repair.

threads.name: Synthetic Modeling of Regeneration

milestones.paper_title: Automated shapeshifting for function recovery in damaged robots
milestones.finding: Proposed using shapeshifting robots as scientific tools to physically instantiate and test biological theories of developmental plasticity and regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Scalable sim-to-real transfer of soft robot designs
milestones.finding: Argued that advances in reprogramming biological growth require hypotheses generated in simulation to be transferable to reality.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Formalized the regeneration process as a generative model (Bayesian inference) that must be tested at the bench with realistic parameters.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the convergence of robotics, simulation, and biology. Researchers are developing synthetic substrates (soft robots and computer models) to test and accelerate the understanding of how biological systems achieve rapid anatomical control.

threads.name: Target-Driven Anatomical Reprogramming

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Argued that true regenerative potential requires controlling large-scale multicellular structures as "computational tissues" rather than manipulating individual cells.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposed a framework where anatomical control is achieved via "rewards and punishments" (setpoint manipulation) rather than micromanaging pathway hardware.

threads.narrative: This thread outlines a theoretical shift from bottom-up molecular editing to top-down morphological management. The research suggests that achieving regenerative narratives requires interfacing with the system's goal states (setpoints) rather than its low-level hardware.

threads.name: Regenerative Capacity and Immortality

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.
milestones.finding: Identified neoblasts as the persistent population of undifferentiated cells enabling constant tissue turnover and regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: A Second-Generation Device for Automated Training and Quantitative Behavior Analyses of Molecularly-Tractable Model Organisms
milestones.finding: Validated the organism's unique capability to regenerate a functioning whole worm from only a small body section.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Characterized planaria as biologically immortal individuals that have 'conquered aging' through continuous tissue regeneration.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the foundational biological facts supporting the claim. It moves from identifying the cellular engine (neoblasts) to validating the macroscopic capability (whole-body regeneration) and finally defining the organism as biologically immortal due to these processes.

threads.name: Cancer Resistance Paradox

milestones.paper_title: A Second-Generation Device for Automated Training and Quantitative Behavior Analyses of Molecularly-Tractable Model Organisms
milestones.finding: Established planaria as a recognized model system specifically for the study of cancer biology.

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Noted that despite somatic inheritance and accumulating mutations (mixoploidy), planaria successfully maintain anatomical homeostasis without succumbing to cancer.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalized the paradox of how an organism with an 'extremely messy genome' and high stem cell volume maintains the best cancer resistance.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the scientific inquiry into the specific claim that planaria do not get cancer. It progresses from establishing the animal as a cancer model to highlighting the theoretical difficulty of explaining how they suppress tumors despite having genomic instability and a vast number of stem cells.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Growth Control

milestones.paper_title: Inhibition of Planar Cell Polarity Extends Neural Growth During Regeneration, Homeostasis, and Development
milestones.finding: Investigated planar cell polarity as a regulatory mechanism that signals when tissues should stop growing, a critical factor in preventing tumorous growth.

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Proposed bioelectric networks as the computational substrate that processes long-term inputs to control regeneration and growth patterning.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the physiological mechanisms that allow planaria to regenerate without uncontrolled cell division (cancer). It identifies specific pathways, such as planar cell polarity and bioelectric signaling, that regulate the 'stop' signals in tissue growth.

threads.name: Experimental Validation of Memory Regeneration

milestones.paper_title: A Second-Generation Device for Automated Training and Quantitative Behavior Analyses of Molecularly-Tractable Model Organisms
milestones.finding: Acknowledges the historical controversies of McConnell's 1960s work on planarian learning while introducing automated tools to rigorously validate these phenomena.

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Cites both classical studies and modern automated analysis (Shomrat & Levin, 2013) to confirm behavioral memory dynamics persist during complete brain regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Synthesizes the evidence to assert that memories persist following brain regeneration, using this as proof that prior knowledge is transferred to the nascent brain.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the validation of the claim from historical controversy to modern acceptance. It begins with the development of automated tools to address skepticism regarding early 20th-century studies, followed by the confirmation of memory retention in regenerating planaria through replicated, automated experiments, eventually establishing the phenomenon as a key evidentiary pillar for non-neural cognition.

threads.name: Bioelectric Mechanism of Pattern Memory

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Establishes planaria as a model for 'anatomical homeostasis,' demonstrating their ability to reliably regenerate complex systems and maintain functional health indefinitely.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes 'Pattern Memory' driven by bioelectrical distributions (via gap junctions) as the mechanism allowing somatic tissues to store information independent of the brain.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical move from observation to explanation. It contextualizes the claim within the framework of 'anatomical homeostasis' and proposes bioelectricity as the storage medium for information (both morphological and behavioral) in the absence of a brain, explaining how the tail 'remembers' what to regenerate.

threads.name: Bioelectric Mechanism of Somatic Computation

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Proposes the hypothesis that non-neural cells communicating via gap junctions can store information and make decisions like neural networks.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectric networks as the ancient "cognitive glue" that enables spatially distributed cells to perform coherent, adaptive computations.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery and modeling of bioelectricity as the physical mechanism allowing somatic cells to form computational networks. It progresses from early hypotheses about gap-junctional decision-making to formal models of somatic computation and the recognition of bioelectricity as a fundamental cognitive substrate.

threads.name: Scaling Cognition from Cells to Tissues

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes that single cells possess complex cognitive capabilities, such as arithmetic and filtering, typically associated with neural networks.

milestones.finding: Theorizes that gap junctions allow cellular collectives to merge into a larger "self" by expanding spatial and temporal perception.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of the "cognitive light cone," describing how cellular networking increases the scale of memory and prediction for the collective.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical framework for how individual competent cells combine to form a larger "true brain" or cognitive entity. It moves from recognizing single-cell intelligence to explaining how networking expands the cognitive boundaries of the collective tissue.

threads.name: Universality of Neural-Like Dynamics

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Uses bioengineered systems to demonstrate that cognition is multiply realizable and not limited to traditional neural architectures.

threads.narrative: This thread provides converging evidence from diverse biological systems (slime molds, planaria, bioengineered tissues) showing that neural-like processing is a general property of living networks, not unique to brains. It supports the claim by illustrating that somatic networks functionally replicate neural dynamics.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Planarian Polarity

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Establishes that bioelectric gradients determine large-scale patterns and tissue regulation via contact-dependent depolarization.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery that electrical patterns actively control anatomical polarity rather than merely accompanying it. The research progressed from identifying bioelectric signaling in pattern formation to demonstrating that manipulating these voltage gradients allows for the deliberate rewriting of the planarian body plan (e.g., head vs. tail location).

threads.name: Bioelectricity as Morphogenetic Software

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Characterizes the bioelectric system for head control as a 'programmable interface' that integrates cell behaviors toward large-scale morphogenetic goals.

It argues that these electrical patterns constitute a programmable memory system that defines the target morphology the organism attempts to build.

threads.name: Neuropharmacology and Drug Addiction Models

milestones.finding: Cites the robustness of planaria in exhibiting behavioral responses relevant to drug addiction research alongside memory paradigms.

threads.narrative: This thread demonstrates the indirect but conclusive evidence of shared neurotransmitters through functional application. By successfully using planaria as models for drug addiction (which targets specific neurotransmitter systems like dopamine and serotonin), researchers validate the existence of these conserved chemical pathways.

milestones.paper_title: Planarians: a versatile and powerful model system for molecular studies of regeneration, adult stem cell regulation, aging, and behavior.

threads.narrative: This thread builds the anatomical and evolutionary argument for the claim. By establishing that planaria possess a 'true brain' and complex CNS capable of learning and memory, the literature supports the necessity of a complex neurochemical signaling system homologous to that of humans.

threads.name: Theoretical Framework of Morphogenetic Memory

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical shift towards viewing bioelectric patterns as a form of non-genetic memory or 'software.' threads.name: Bioelectric Rewriting of Morphology

threads.narrative: This thread traces the experimental validation of inducing two-headed planaria through bioelectric manipulation. threads.name: Physiological Software and Agential Control

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical explanation for why cells build a two-headed worm despite a wild-type genome. It establishes the concept of bioelectricity as a control layer (software) that manages cellular collective intelligence, independent of the underlying genetic hardware.

threads.name: Bioelectric Encoding of Morphology

milestones.finding: Framed non-neural bioelectricity as the computational medium for somatic decision-making and memory during development.

threads.name: Bioelectricity as Reprogrammable Software

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for the claim that bioelectricity acts as a "programmable calculator." milestones.finding: Described how bioelectric target patterns can change rapidly and pull anatomical patterns along, functioning as a stress-minimizing loop.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of how bioelectric states function as a rewritable memory. threads.name: Validation of Non-Genetic Reprogramming

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.

threads.name: Mechanism of Bioelectric Pattern Control

threads.name: Morphological Information and Memory

milestones.finding: Proposes "proto-cognitive" frameworks to explain how cellular collectives store and execute specific morphological plans (like head shape).

threads.name: Genomic Instability vs Anatomical Stasis

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.

milestones.finding: Formalizes the paradox that planaria are "mixoploid chimeras with an extremely messy genome" yet maintain the highest levels of anatomical fidelity and cancer resistance.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the core biological paradox: planarians accumulate significant genomic noise and mutation (mixoploidy) through asexual reproduction, yet maintain distinct, rock-solid anatomical structures. It moves from the observation of cellular heterogeneity to the theoretical framing of how "messy genomes" coexist with perfect anatomical homeostasis.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control of Morphological State

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks

milestones.finding: Proposes that bioelectric fields act as "physiological software" that can overwrite genomic pattern memory, providing a mechanism for anatomical stability despite genomic divergence.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the mechanism allowing anatomical stability despite the "messy genome." It posits that bioelectric networks function as a layer of software that orchestrates cellular behavior and anatomical patterning, effectively overriding the noise or defects present at the genetic level.

threads.name: Genomic Noise vs Anatomical Fidelity

threads.name: Evolution of Problem-Solving Algorithms

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical argument that evolution optimized the morphogenetic algorithm's robustness (competency), which consequently reduced the selective pressure to maintain a pristine genome.

threads.name: Mechanisms of Somatic Computation

threads.name: Evolutionary Generalization via Agential Materials

threads.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture (MCA)

threads.narrative: This thread traces the development of Multiscale Competency Architecture (MCA) as the mechanism explaining why biology produces "problem-solving machines." It progresses from defining how MCA accelerates evolutionary search, to observing goal-directed behavior in development, to establishing how this competency allows evolution to exploit cellular intelligence.

threads.name: Theoretical Framework of Morphological Competency

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Provides empirical evidence of the organism's innate ability to correct and reorganize anatomy, suggesting a goal-directed morphological system.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formalizes the observation of ectopic function as 'multiscale competency,' arguing that biological tissues possess an inherent capacity to handle anatomical novelty.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the conceptual explanation for why an organism can utilize a misplaced organ, proposing that biological systems are "agential materials" capable of adapting to novel configurations rather than fixed genetic hardwiring.

threads.name: Genomic Chaos vs. Morphological Stability

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Observes that planaria exhibit somatic inheritance and mixoploidy (divergent genomes), yet maintain anatomical homeostasis, suggesting the body plan is robust against genomic messiness.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Proposes examining how the morphogenetic algorithm handles extreme genomic variation by creating chimeras of different species to test if a dominant shape emerges.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the premise that planarian morphology is surprisingly independent of strict genomic uniformity. Research progresses from observing natural genomic divergence (mixoploidy) within functional worms to proposing chimeric experiments that test the limits of this algorithmic robustness.

threads.name: Evolution of Physiological Software

milestones.paper_title: Inferring Regulatory Networks from Experimental Morphological Phenotypes: A Computational Method Reverse-Engineers Planarian Regeneration
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that the regenerative logic can be reverse-engineered as a computational algorithm, distinct from the biological substrate.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Conceptualizes an 'evolutionary intelligence ratchet' where evolution selects for versatile problem-solving machinery (algorithms) rather than just specific hard-coded phenotypes.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Argues that evolution pivots these established goal-seeking mechanisms across different problem spaces (metabolic, morphological, behavioral) to create adaptive organisms.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical basis for *why* the 'effort went into the algorithm.' It traces the move from computationally defining the regenerative network to framing evolution as a process that optimizes these competency-based algorithms to solve morphological problems.

threads.name: Dissolving the Organism-Machine Distinction

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Proposes that computer-designed organisms (biobots) stretch current philosophical categories and reveal how non-neural tissues process information.

milestones.paper_title: Generalizing frameworks for sentience beyond natural species
milestones.finding: Argues that biorobotics and evolutionary strategies are blurring the line between evolved organisms and designed machines.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Establishes a framework for AI and bio-robotic hybrids that challenges traditional distinctions by demonstrating self-organizing cognitive patterns.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical collapse of the rigid dichotomy between 'living organism' and 'designed machine.' It moves from the initial introduction of computer-designed organisms to a broader framework where technological and biological agents are viewed on a continuum of agency and design.

threads.name: Emergence of Basal Cognition in Synthetic Systems

milestones.paper_title: Automated shapeshifting for function recovery in damaged robots
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that computational control circuitry in robots can be the object of evolutionary design, enabling rudimentary shape-change and regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Identifies that non-neural tissue networks in biobots possess intrinsic capabilities for scaling basal cognition and biological computation.

milestones.paper_title: Generalizing frameworks for sentience beyond natural species
milestones.finding: Validates the existence of proto-cognitive capacities in 'hybrots' (cultured brains with robotic bodies) and closed-loop biological-machine platforms.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence that cognition is not solely a property of evolved brains but a mechanism available to synthetic and hybrid systems. The research progresses from mechanical shapeshifting to biological information processing in non-neural tissues, supporting the claim that old definitions of cognition are outdated.

threads.name: Blurring Organism-Machine Boundaries

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Biobots are identified as a technology that stretches current categories, prompting a philosophical re-evaluation of the distinction between organisms and machines.

milestones.paper_title: Generalizing frameworks for sentience beyond natural species
milestones.finding: Biorobotics and hybrots are shown to blur the line between evolved and designed agents, revealing proto-cognitive capacities in novel configurations.
Commentaries explicitly challenge the utility of binary categories like "robot" versus "machine," arguing they impede progress and understanding of flexible, adaptive systems.

threads.narrative: This thread tracks the dissolution of the traditional dichotomy between biological organisms and artificial machines. Starting with the emergence of computer-designed organisms that defy easy classification, the narrative progresses to a theoretical stance that views these binary categories as limiting, proposing instead a continuum of evolved and designed systems.

threads.name: Substrate-Independent Cognition

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Establishes the principle of implementation-independence in biology, arguing that cognitive functions like decision-making are not exclusive to neural substrates.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Reframes the concept of "self" and "individual" not as sharp biological lines but as computational boundaries defined by information processing and cooperation.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Argues that nature makes no distinction between neural and non-neural fields, supporting the use of bio-engineered systems to isolate and study cognition-promoting algorithms.

threads.narrative: This thread provides the mechanism for why binary categories are obsolete: cognition and selfhood are functional, computational properties rather than specific biological ones. Research moves from asserting cognition in non-neural systems to defining 'self' via computation, ultimately showing that sentience is multiply realizable across diverse biological and artificial substrates.

threads.name: Integration of Synthetic Architectures

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Establishes that non-neural bioelectric networks can be modeled as computational substrates for synthetic living machines.

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Identifies the transition of synthetic biology from merely rewiring metabolism to creating synthetic morphology via guided self-assembly.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Proposes a specific synthetic biology architecture to incorporate intelligence and computational tasks into novel biological constructs.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical evolution from viewing tissues as bioelectric computational substrates to explicitly proposing synthetic biology architectures that can control morphogenesis. It supports the claim that synthetic circuits will be merged with biological forms to enable programmable structure and function.

threads.name: From Passive Forms to Agential Systems

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Outlines future goals where biobots move beyond static forms to perform specific functions like drug delivery or environmental cleanup.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Reframes biological materials as possessing 'agency' that can be 'hacked' or manipulated to force cells into building entirely new, functional forms.

threads.narrative: This thread follows the shift in understanding regarding how to get biological constructs to 'do new things.' It progresses from identifying desired applications to uncovering the underlying mechanism of 'agential materials' that allows cells to be repurposed for novel behaviors beyond their evolutionary default.

threads.name: Embryonic Plasticity and Twin Formation

milestones.paper_title: The compulsion of chirality: toward an understanding of left-right asymmetry.
milestones.finding: Identified that monozygotic twins exhibit mirror-image asymmetries, suggesting the splitting event impacts developmental patterning early in cell division.

milestones.paper_title: Polarity proteins are required for left–right axis orientation and twin–twin instruction
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that secondary embryonic axes (twins) can be induced and will instruct each other via polarity proteins, confirming the embryo's plasticity to form multiple bodies.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Explicitly validated that scratching (cutting) a blastoderm causes isolated islands to form independent embryos (twins) rather than partial bodies, due to the system's excitability.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the understanding of twinning from an observational phenomenon of asymmetry to a mechanically inducible event. It culminates in recent evidence showing that physical separation (like scratching/cutting) of the blastoderm triggers independent morphogenetic processes, resulting in multiple whole organisms rather than partial fragments.

threads.name: Regenerative Target Morphology

milestones.paper_title: Long-range neural and gap junction protein-mediated cues control polarity during planarian regeneration.
milestones.finding: Established that bisection of organisms (planaria) leads to regeneration of the specific body plan, a trait that persists across reproductive modes.

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposed the concept of "somatic pattern memories," arguing that the body's primary task is to maintain anatomical integrity and specific 3D patterns against disruption.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Framed morphogenesis as a problem-solving process where bioelectric networks allow a system to navigate back to a target morphology (a whole body) even after severe injury.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical basis for why "cutting" results in "perfectly normal bodies" rather than half-bodies. It establishes that biological systems possess an inherent target morphology or pattern memory, driven by bioelectric networks, which ensures that fragments regenerate into complete wholes.

threads.name: Counterfactual Goal States in Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Proposes that organisms maintain a specific "pattern memory" or target morphology that serves as a goal state distinct from current anatomical reality.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes bioelectric target morphologies as "counterfactual representations" that encode what anatomy should look like rather than its current state.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Refines the concept to describe these networks as storing memories tied to a "possible future" rather than a readout of the past or present.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical basis for the claim by shifting the view of morphogenesis from a history-dependent emergence to a goal-dependent process. It posits that biology operates on "counterfactuals"—future goal states—allowing systems to ignore current or past deviations to reach a specific outcome.

threads.name: Agential Interpretation of Genetic History

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Observes that regulative development allows organisms to reach correct anatomical goals despite drastic deviations in their starting conditions.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates through Xenobots that cells can interpret the same standard genome in radically different ways, showing they are not rigidly bound by evolutionary history.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence that biological materials are not strictly constrained by their past (genetic history or starting physical state). Instead, they exhibit "agential" properties, actively interpreting genetic data to navigate novel environments or anatomical configurations.

threads.name: Persistence of Memory Through Remodeling

milestones.paper_title: Planarian regeneration as a model of anatomical homeostasis: Recent progress in biophysical and computational approaches.
milestones.finding: Discusses how pattern memory can be experimentally overwritten, separating the informational content from the physical substrate's history.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Reviews evidence that memories persist across drastic remodeling events, such as brain regeneration in planaria or metamorphosis in insects.

threads.narrative: This thread synthesizes evidence from different organisms to show that cognitive and morphological information is not destroyed by the reconstruction of the physical body. This supports the claim that biology does not assume the future must rigidly follow the physical constraints of the immediate past.

threads.name: Anatomical Invariance Across Scales

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Establishes that kidney tubules maintain identical diameter whether formed by communicating groups of ~10 cells or single giant cells bending around themselves.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Validates the kidney tubule phenomenon as a key example where diverse molecular mechanisms are deployed to reach the same large-scale morphological goal.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Highlights animals with extra genome copies (polyploidy) producing huge cells as a radical example of materials adjusting to genomic changes.

threads.narrative: This thread tracks the specific biological evidence regarding newt kidney tubules, highlighting the observation that anatomical structure persists despite drastic changes in cell size and number. It progresses from the detailed description of the phenomenon to its classification as a robust example of phenotypic plasticity invariant to low-level hardware changes.

threads.name: Goal-Directed Morphogenesis Framework

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Uses the tubule example to argue for a 'computational boundary' where systems harness diverse mechanisms to achieve anatomical setpoints.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of 'Multi-Scale Competency,' positing that morphogenesis is an error-minimization loop toward a stored target morphology rather than a hardwired set of movements.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Integrates the robustness to cell size changes into an 'Active Inference' model, demonstrating that anatomical repair is not hardwired but a cooperative computational process.

threads.narrative: This thread develops the theoretical implications of the claim, positing that such morphological robustness indicates goal-directed agency rather than hardwired genetic determinism. It moves from defining 'scale-free cognition' to formalizing 'multi-scale competency' and finally integrating these observations into an active inference computational model.

threads.name: Morphological Competency and Self-Correction

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that tadpoles can normalize their craniofacial shape despite significant initial perturbations, showing the system overrides historical errors to reach a target.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Highlighted that transplanted eyes function correctly even in abnormal locations (tails), proving that biological function is not strictly bound by standard developmental history.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence that biological systems do not strictly adhere to a deterministic chain of past events (the "expected" history). Instead, organisms display an innate competency to correct morphological defects and establish functionality in novel configurations, prioritizing a target state over their specific developmental past.

threads.name: Goal-Directedness as Active Inference

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Proposed a generative model where morphogenesis is treated as Bayesian inference, suggesting systems actively minimize deviation from a target rather than passively unfolding.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Modeled specific computational aspects of morphogenesis to show how biological systems navigate complex conditions to maintain integrity.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Conceptualized bioelectric networks as storing "counterfactual memory"—representations of possible future states—allowing systems to act based on goals rather than just current anatomical reads.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from viewing development as a history-dependent mechanical process to a goal-directed computational one. By framing morphogenesis as active inference and identifying mechanisms for counterfactual memory, these papers explain how biology can ignore the "past" to achieve expected outcomes through representational plasticity.

threads.name: Anatomical Homeostasis via Structural Plasticity

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Describes the specific phenomenon where giant cells use cytoskeletal bending to mimic the tubule structure usually formed by cell-cell communication.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identifies this phenomenon as 'plasticity and coarse-graining', where diverse molecular mechanisms are deployed to reach the same large-scale goal.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Links the production of 'huge cells' (via genome duplication) to the general capacity of biological systems to respond to genomic changes.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the specific biological observation of newt kidney tubules maintaining anatomical constancy despite radical changes in cell size. The research establishes that the system can substitute intercellular communication with intracellular cytoskeletal bending to achieve the same morphological output.

threads.name: Goal-Directed Morphogenesis Framework

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Uses the cell-wrapping observation to argue for 'Scale-Free Cognition', characterizing morphogenesis as a computational process targeting specific shapes.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Incorporates the finding into the TAME framework, arguing that genetics seeds an error-minimization loop rather than an invariant set of movements.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Provides converging evidence via 'Picasso tadpoles', showing that bioelectric networks allow creative problem-solving to achieve morphological goals despite scrambled inputs.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical integration of the claim into a broader model of biological cognition. It posits that morphogenesis is driven by top-down anatomical setpoints (goals) that can harness various bottom-up molecular mechanisms to handle novel configurations.

threads.name: Recruitment of Polarity Pathways

milestones.paper_title: Left‐right asymmetry in the chick embryo requires core planar cell polarity protein Vangl2
milestones.finding: Identifies that the Planar Cell Polarity (PCP) protein Vangl2 is recruited to establish left-right asymmetry in chick embryos.

milestones.paper_title: Polarity proteins are required for left–right axis orientation and twin–twin instruction
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that Apical-Basal Polarity (ABP) and PCP proteins are required for the large-scale orientation of the left-right axis and twin-twin instruction in Xenopus.

threads.narrative: This experimental thread provides concrete examples of the claim by showing how conserved molecular modules (PCP and ABP pathways) are 'called up' to service the establishment of a large-scale anatomical feature (the Left-Right axis) across different species.

threads.name: Theory of Agential Morphogenesis

milestones.paper_title: What's left in asymmetry?
milestones.finding: Highlights major open questions in asymmetry, framing the need to investigate mechanisms beyond established pathways.

milestones.paper_title: Closing the loop on morphogenesis: a mathematical model of morphogenesis by closed-loop reaction-diffusion
milestones.finding: Provides mathematical modeling of how large-scale morphogenetic order acts as a loop leveraging molecular events.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Formally proposes the multiscale competency framework, arguing that developmental physiology acts as a control layer that recruits various molecular mechanisms to achieve anatomical goals.

threads.narrative: This theoretical thread traces the conceptual evolution from identifying gaps in understanding asymmetry to formally modeling and articulating a framework where physiological competency allows anatomical goals to flexibly recruit molecular mechanisms.

threads.name: Bioelectric Control Mechanism

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Proposed that multicellular constructs can be programmed as excitable media, enabling the development of "computational tissues".

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Established modeling foundations to construct "computational synthetic living machines" using non-neural bioelectric networks.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Identified bioelectricity as the interface enabling adaptive information processing across natural, artificial, and hybrid substrates.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of bioelectricity as the distinct control mechanism that enables biological interoperability. It moves from early proposals of reprogramming tissues as computational media to formal models for synthetic living machines, concluding that bioelectricity acts as the "cognitive glue" allowing life to function across different materials.

threads.name: Substrate-Independent Agency

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Theorized that biological subunits are competent and can be integrated into new, robust goal-seeking systems, bridging biology and robotics.

milestones.paper_title: Applications and ethics of computer-designed organisms
milestones.finding: Discussed the creation of computer-designed organisms, demonstrating the practical interoperability of biological life with engineering design.

milestones.paper_title: Collective intelligence: A unifying concept for integrating biology across scales and substrates
milestones.finding: Formalized a framework where biological function persists across distinct problem spaces and substrates, supporting life's adaptability to foreign materials.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for life's interoperability, positing that cognition and agency are scale-free and substrate-independent. It progresses from defining the computational boundaries of the "self" to applying these concepts in computer-designed organisms, supporting the claim that biological function persists regardless of the underlying material or components.

threads.name: Experimental Evidence of Morphological Plasticity

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that tadpoles possess an innate ability to correct craniofacial perturbations to achieve a target morphology despite abnormal starting conditions.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Highlighted extreme plasticity examples, such as functional ectopic eyes and Xenobots, where cells ignore standard genetic expectations to form novel structures.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
milestones.finding: Showed that embryos can collectively overcome environmental history (teratogen exposure) to survive, defying the expected outcome of individual damage.

threads.narrative: This thread aggregates empirical evidence showing that biological systems can deviate from their expected historical or genetic trajectories to achieve functional outcomes. It progresses from observing self-repair in individual craniofacial structures to identifying collective agency and extreme anatomical reprogramming.

threads.name: Goal-Directedness via Active Inference

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Established a framework viewing morphogenesis as a goal-seeking process driven by generative models rather than just initial conditions or historical constraints.

milestones.paper_title: Active inference, morphogenesis, and computational psychiatry
milestones.finding: Applied active inference models to explain how biological systems navigate complex states without reductionist historical assumptions.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Defined bioelectric networks as storing "counterfactual memory" of future states, allowing systems to act based on goals rather than just past history.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical shift from viewing development as a hardwired execution of past instructions to a computational process of active inference. It posits that biological systems use predictive models to navigate toward future goal states, effectively ignoring or overwriting "expected" historical constraints.

threads.name: Multi-Scale Competency Framework

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Identifies the kidney tubule phenomenon as evidence that anatomical goals are decoupled from cellular-level details like cell number.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the phenomenon as "Multi-Scale Competency," characterizing it as collective cognition that coarse-grains over subunit states.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Extends the concept to evolution, arguing that this competency allows organisms to maintain structure despite radical genomic changes like polyploidy.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the theoretical abstraction of the cell-size scaling phenomenon, moving from an example of "scale-free cognition" to a formal definition of "multi-scale competency" and finally to its evolutionary implications as a property of "agential materials."

threads.name: Anatomical Error Correction

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Proposes that morphogenesis functions as an error-minimization loop targeting a stored anatomical setpoint, utilizing the cell-size case as a key example.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Corroborates the principle of anatomical plasticity using "Picasso tadpoles," showing that diverse starting states can still converge on the correct target morphology.

threads.narrative: This thread contextualizes the claim within a broader range of plastic behaviors, linking the ability to compensate for cell size with the ability to correct for scrambled organ positions, supporting the theory of homeostatic error-correction.

threads.name: Plasticity in Anatomical Homeostasis

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that tadpoles with surgically scrambled faces rearrange organs via novel paths to achieve a normal craniofacial structure.

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Highlights that kidney tubules maintain constant diameter using cytoskeletal bending rather than cell-cell communication when cell size is drastically altered.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Reframes the tadpole data to argue that organs use 'novel paths' and different distances to achieve the target morphology, validating mechanism flexibility.

threads.narrative: This thread traces experimental evidence showing that biological systems prioritize the final anatomical shape over specific developmental trajectories. It begins with the observation of craniofacial correction in Xenopus, evolves to compare distinct molecular mechanisms in kidney tubule formation, and concludes with a synthesis viewing these phenomena as adaptive morphogenesis using flexible pathways.

threads.name: Computational Modeling of Morphological Goals

milestones.paper_title: Inferring Regulatory Networks from Experimental Morphological Phenotypes: A Computational Method Reverse-Engineers Planarian Regeneration
milestones.finding: Argues that standard genetic diagrams fail to explain geometry and introduces computational methods to find mechanisms responsible for anatomical goals.

milestones.paper_title: Automated shapeshifting for function recovery in damaged robots
milestones.finding: Identifies the ability to harness low-level components (cells) towards specific large-scale goal-states as a key design challenge for regenerative robotics.

milestones.paper_title: The nonlinearity of regulation in biological networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that imposing biological constraints on networks increases their capacity for anatomical homeostasis and guided self-assembly.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the theoretical and computational underpinnings of how systems manage high-level anatomical goals. It moves from criticizing static genetic models to proposing dynamic computational frameworks and constraints that allow low-level components to cooperatively achieve large-scale structural targets.

threads.name: Bioelectric Interfacing and Programmability

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Establishes that endogenous electric fields and gap junctions coordinate morphogenesis, allowing for external interface via electrodes.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric modulation of wound healing in a 3D in vitro model of tissue-engineered bone.
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that external bioelectric modulation successfully controls cell behavior and regeneration in a 3D tissue model.

milestones.paper_title: Reprogramming cells and tissue patterning via bioelectrical pathways: molecular mechanisms and biomedical opportunities
milestones.finding: Formalizes the theory that tissues function as programmable excitable media that can be interoperably controlled like computational constructs.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery that biological tissues function as electrically excitable media, allowing them to interface with external electrical inputs. Initial work identified the tools and mechanisms (electrodes, gap junctions) for this signaling, followed by experimental validation in tissue models, and culminating in a theoretical framework of biological 'programmability'.

threads.name: Biomaterial and Device Integration

milestones.paper_title: BioDome regenerative sleeve for biochemical and biophysical stimulation of tissue regeneration.
milestones.finding: Validates a mechanical device (BioDome) that successfully interfaces with wound sites to provide a protected environment for regeneration.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric modulation of wound healing in a 3D in vitro model of tissue-engineered bone.
milestones.finding: Utilizes polymeric and natural biomaterials as substrates for tissue engineering, showing cells function effectively within synthetic constructs.

threads.narrative: This thread provides experimental evidence that biological systems can maintain regenerative function when physically integrated with synthetic materials and devices. It progresses from mechanical sleeves protecting wound sites to the integration of cells with polymeric biomaterials for tissue engineering.

threads.name: Target Morphology and Goal-Directedness

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric mechanisms in regeneration: Unique aspects and future perspectives.
milestones.finding: Proposes 'morphostasis,' suggesting organisms maintain a specific 'target morphology' defined by bioelectric signals rather than just genetic hardcoding.

milestones.paper_title: Normalized shape and location of perturbed craniofacial structures in the Xenopus tadpole reveal an innate ability to achieve correct morphology
milestones.finding: Demonstrates experimentally that perturbed craniofacial systems possess an innate ability to correct their geometry, maximizing specific morphogenetic quantities.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Formalizes the concept of goal-directed activity in morphogenesis, where systems (like salamander limbs) achieve robust anatomical outcomes despite varying starting conditions.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes that biological systems are not merely executing a fixed genetic recipe but are striving toward a specific geometric goal (target morphology). It traces the development from early concepts of morphostasis to experimental validation in Xenopus and eventual formalization into a framework of anatomical goal-directedness.

threads.name: Physiology as the Missing Control Layer

milestones.paper_title: Inferring Regulatory Networks from Experimental Morphological Phenotypes: A Computational Method Reverse-Engineers Planarian Regeneration
milestones.finding: Argues that standard genetic regulatory network diagrams fail to specify or explain the complex geometry and regenerative regulation of biological systems.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Identifies physiological processes as the neglected 'control layer' that sits between genomically specified cellular hardware and the final phenotype.

milestones.paper_title: Embryos assist morphogenesis of others through calcium and ATP signaling mechanisms in collective teratogen resistance
milestones.finding: Provides mechanistic evidence that physiological signaling (Calcium and ATP) allows embryos to actively manage morphogenesis and resist disruption collectively.

threads.narrative: This thread addresses the claim's core argument that genetics alone is insufficient by identifying the physiological software that bridges the gap between genome and anatomy. It moves from identifying the limitations of genetic arrows to proposing physiology as the control layer, and finally providing mechanistic examples of this signaling in action.

threads.name: Anatomical Competency and Plasticity

milestones.paper_title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition
milestones.finding: Demonstrates that tissues (muscles, vessels) autonomously adapt to support ectopic bone, solving anatomical problems without explicit top-down instruction.

milestones.paper_title: Morphogenesis as Bayesian inference: A variational approach to pattern formation and control in complex biological systems.
milestones.finding: Proposes a generative, variational model where biological systems actively infer and correct toward setpoints, providing a mechanism for stability amidst perturbation.

milestones.paper_title: Bioelectric networks: the cognitive glue enabling evolutionary scaling from physiology to mind
milestones.finding: Frames anatomical plasticity as "creative problem-solving" (Jamesian intelligence), enabling systems to reach goals even when standard assumptions or means fail.

threads.narrative: This thread validates the claim that biological hardware possesses inherent problem-solving capacities. It progresses from observing specific anatomical adaptations (ectopic fingers) to modeling the mechanism as Bayesian inference, finally conceptualizing it as a form of non-neural cognition that handles novelty.

threads.name: Multi-Scale Competency in Evolution

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Argues that Multi-Scale Autonomy (MCA) raises the "IQ" of the evolutionary search process by allowing systems to find solutions via physiological competency.

milestones.paper_title: Darwin’s agential materials: evolutionary implications of multiscale competency in developmental biology
milestones.finding: Theorizes that developmental competency smooths the "rugged" evolutionary landscape, masking deleterious mutations (cryptic variance) and facilitating movement across morphospace.

threads.narrative: This thread addresses the evolutionary aspect of the claim, proposing that the "problem-solving capacity" of the hardware is what enables evolution to work efficiently. It suggests that biological materials are "agential," allowing evolution to exploit stable baselines while physiological layers handle the complexities of implementation.

threads.name: Substrate-Independent Cognitive Frameworks

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Proposes a pragmatic, engineering-based definition of cognition that avoids brain-centric philosophical issues.

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Introduces the TAME framework to explicitly disrupt categories based on static, brain-based animal models.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Formalizes the functionalist perspective that cognition is multiply realizable and not dependent on neural substrates.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes the theoretical basis for rejecting the brain as the sole seat of cognition. It progresses from a pragmatic call to broaden cognitive definitions in 2016 to the formalization of substrate-independent frameworks (TAME) that encompass diverse biological and artificial systems.

threads.name: Bioelectric Basis of Non-Neural Cognition

milestones.finding: Identifies bioelectricity as the specific mechanistic 'glue' that allows cognitive scaling from simple physiology to complex minds.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of the physical mechanisms that allow cognition to occur without a brain. It moves from computational modeling of somatic cells to identifying bioelectric networks as the essential driver of cognitive scaling across evolutionary history.

threads.name: Distributed Problem-Solving in Morphospace

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Connects morphogenesis directly to cognition by framing biological development as a flexible problem-solving process.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Argues that mental properties like decision-making are deeply intertwined with non-neural body systems like immunity.

milestones.finding: Validates that basal intelligence can be modeled via simple sorting algorithms, reinforcing intelligence as problem-solving rather than anatomy.

threads.narrative: This thread expands the domain of cognition from 3D behavior to physiological and morphological spaces. threads.name: Non-Neural Bioelectric Computation

milestones.paper_title: Modeling somatic computation with non-neural bioelectric networks
milestones.finding: Demonstrated that non-neural bioelectric networks (BEN) contain weight and bias parameters sufficient to perform computations resembling neural networks.

milestones.finding: Investigated whether electrical signaling is intrinsic to sentience or if subcellular systems and active matter can encode similar cognitive rules.

threads.narrative: This thread traces the discovery of mechanisms allowing non-neural architectures to process information. It progresses from computational modeling of bioelectric networks to a broader generalization that electrical activity, rather than specific neuronal cells, provides the substrate for cognition.

threads.name: Substrate Independence Frameworks

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Established the TAME framework, arguing that there is no privileged material substrate for a "Self" and integrating basal cognition into intelligence research.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Formalized the functionalist perspective that cognitive systems are multiply realizable and not restricted to neural substrates, drawing parallels to neuromorphic AI.

threads.narrative: This thread represents the theoretical evolution of the "substrate independence" claim. It moves from the introduction of an inclusive framework (TAME) for diverse intelligences to a specific argument for multiple realizability that encompasses biological, bioengineered, and artificial systems.

threads.name: Cellular and Subcellular Cognition

milestones.paper_title: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere: An Experimentally-Grounded Framework for Understanding Diverse Bodies and Minds
milestones.finding: Identified basal cognition in non-neural systems as a critical area for understanding diverse intelligences beyond standard biological categories.

milestones.paper_title: The brain is not mental! coupling neuronal and immune cellular processing in human organisms
milestones.finding: Argued that cells (both neuronal and non-neuronal/immune) are the fundamental responsive units of adaptation, supporting a distributed cognition model.

milestones.paper_title: The Multiple Realizability of Sentience in Living Systems and Beyond
milestones.finding: Extended the scope of potential cognitive systems down to the subcellular scale, implicating microtubules and gene regulatory networks.

threads.narrative: This thread explores the minimal scale at which cognitive principles apply, generalizing the claim across biological domains. It shifts the focus from the organ level (brain) to the cellular level, and finally to subcellular components, positing them as alternative architectures for cognitive processes.

threads.name: Cognition in Non-Neural Organisms

milestones.paper_title: On Having No Head: Cognition throughout Biological Systems
milestones.finding: Identified that higher plants, despite lacking brains, exhibit behavioral activity, memory, and bio-communication systems.

milestones.paper_title: Uncovering cognitive similarities and differences, conservation and innovation
milestones.finding: Extended the scope of cognition to fungal mycelia, demonstrating decision-making and communication networks used for foraging.

threads.narrative: This thread establishes that cognitive status extends to organisms lacking traditional neural architectures. threads.name: Morphogenesis as Somatic Cognition

milestones.finding: Established experimental protocols for testing learning and memory in developing embryos (tadpoles) to understand functional constraints of early cognition.

milestones.finding: Formalized the concept of 'somatic cognition,' framing morphogenesis as a process where subunits utilize cognitive binding mechanisms to form complex bodies.
